item.content:encoded: Patay na nang matagpuan ang 14-anyos na babae na ilang araw nang nawawala sa Borongan City, Eastern Samar.

item.title: Suspect in kidnap-for-ransom of bank official nabbed after 11 years
item.content:encoded:
kidnap-for-ransom, suspect, Cavite, Makati, 10 years Summary: A suspect involved in a 2013 kidnap-for-ransom case in Cavite was apprehended in Makati after evading authorities for over a decade. The suspect, who has been on the run for more than 10 years, was finally captured in Makati by law enforcement officials. The kidnapping case, which dates back to 2013, involved the abduction of an individual for ransom in Cavite. The suspect's arrest in Makati signifies a breakthrough in the long-standing investigation into the kidnapping crime from several years ago. After years of eluding capture, the suspect behind the ransom kidnapping in Cavite was taken into custody in Makati, marking a significant development in the case.

Summary:

The suspect behind a 2013 kidnap-for-ransom case in Cavite was nabbed in Makati after more than 10 years.

item.title: Two winners bag P89.5-M in Super Lotto 6/49
item.content:encoded:
winners, jackpot prize, Super Lotto 6/49 draw, April 4, Thursday Summary: Two winners emerged as the lucky recipients of the whopping jackpot prize worth over P89 million in the Super Lotto 6/49 draw held on April 4, Thursday night. The news of the winners scoring the grand prize of such a massive amount has garnered attention and excitement among lottery enthusiasts. With the draw taking place on a Thursday night, the fortunate winners can now look forward to claiming their share of the prize money and potentially changing their lives for the better. The jackpot win marks a significant moment in the Super Lotto 6/49 draw history, adding to the allure and anticipation surrounding future draws. As the winners celebrate their remarkable stroke of luck, the draw serves as a reminder of the thrill and unpredictability associated with lottery games, making each draw a suspenseful and exhilarating event for participants and spectators.

Two winners bagged the jackpot prize of over P89 million in the Super Lotto 6/49 draw on April 4, Thursday night.

item.title: Ambulance on way to fetch patients not allowed on EDSA carousel
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Ambulances, patients, EDSA busway, Metropolitan Manila Development Authority, restrictions Summary: Ambulances without patients aboard are prohibited from passing through the EDSA busway, according to the Metropolitan Manila Development Authority (MMDA). This regulation aims to ensure smooth traffic flow and prioritizes the safety and convenience of passengers using the designated bus lanes. The MMDA's decision to restrict ambulances is part of their efforts to enforce strict rules and regulations within the metro. By upholding this policy, they hope to minimize potential conflicts between emergency vehicles and buses, ultimately improving overall road efficiency and emergency response times. Ambulance operators and drivers are advised to comply with these guidelines and seek alternative routes when transporting empty ambulances to avoid penalties and contribute to a more orderly traffic system in Metropolitan Manila.

Summary:

Ambulances without patients on board are not allowed to pass through the EDSA busway, the Metropolitan Manila Development Authority (MMDA) said Thursday.

item.title: Grass fire razes 24 hectares of grassland in Bacolod City
item.content:encoded: A grass fire spread quickly in Bacolod City on Tuesday, which further intensified the hot weather in the area.

item.title: Woman shot at least 10 times inside Tondo home
item.content:encoded: A woman died after being shot no less than ten times inside her home in Tondo, Manila.

item.content:encoded: Nagulantang ang mga dumadalo sa misa sa San Isidro Parish Church sa Binalbagan, Negros Occidental nang biglang rumagasa sa loob ang isang tricycle nitong Miyerkules ng gabi. Ang lalaki sa tricycle, hindi pa nakontento at pumunta sa altar para wasakin ang imahen ng mga santo.

item.content:encoded: Philippine Institute of Volcanology and Seismology (PHIVOLCS) Director Teresito Bacolcol said that the country could experience earthquakes stronger than magnitude 8.

item.content:encoded: National Security Adviser Eduardo Año said Thursday that the rising tensions in the South China Sea would be among the topics which would be discussed during the bilateral meeting between President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. and United States President Joe Biden next week.

item.content:encoded: Philippine and US forces will bring this year's Balikatan joint military exercises beyond the country's territorial waters to the edge of its exclusive economic zone.

item.title: 74-anyos na ina, patay sa pananaga ng sarili niyang anak sa Batangas
item.content:encoded:
murder, mother, attacked, son, family Summary:
A 74-year-old woman was killed by her own son in their home in Talisay, Batangas. The mother was asleep when the son attacked her, resulting in her death. The son also targeted his cousin and two of the cousin's children during the violent incident. The tragic event shocked the community and left the family devastated. The motive behind the son's actions remains unclear, leaving many questions unanswered. The authorities are investigating the case to determine the reasons behind the son's sudden and deadly attack on his own family members. The impact of the brutal incident has left the community in mourning and seeking justice for the victims. Family members and neighbors are left in disbelief over the tragic loss of the elderly woman and the senseless violence that occurred within the family. The community is now coming together to support the grieving family and seek justice for the victims of this horrific crime.

Summary:

Nasawi ang isang ginang na 74-anyos matapos pagtatagain ng sarili niyang anak habang natutulog sa kanilang bahay sa Talisay, Batangas. Pinuntirya rin ng suspek ang kaniyang pinsan at dalawa nitong anak.

item.title: Macron says he has no doubt Russia will target Paris Olympics
item.content:encoded:
keywords: French President, Emmanuel Macron, Russia, Paris Olympics, target Summary: French President Emmanuel Macron expressed his concerns about potential malevolent actions by Russia targeting the Paris Olympics this summer. Macron stated that he had no doubt that Russia would direct its efforts towards disrupting the games. This announcement raises alarm about the safety and security of the upcoming event, with the French government likely to intensify security measures to counteract any potential threats. The statement by Macron underscores the ongoing tensions between Russia and Western nations, highlighting the importance of vigilance and preparedness to prevent any negative impact on the Olympics. The looming specter of malicious Russian interference adds a layer of complexity to the already challenging task of organizing and hosting a major international sporting event amidst a backdrop of geopolitical tensions.

French President Emmanuel Macron said on Thursday that he had no doubt Russia would malevolently target the Paris Olympics this summer.

item.title: DTI, Halal Expo Canada collab targets P230-B in investments
item.content:encoded:
Philippines, Halal Expo, Department of Trade and Industry, Canada, investments Summary: The Halal Expo Philippines, a joint effort between the Department of Trade and Industry and Canada, is set to launch in the last quarter of 2024. With the aim of creating up to P230 billion in investments, the expo is expected to attract a wide range of businesses in the Halal industry. This significant collaboration signifies a strong partnership between the two countries and is poised to boost the economy by attracting investors and promoting trade in the Halal sector. The expo will provide a platform for companies to showcase their Halal products and services, opening up opportunities for growth and expansion in the market. By bringing together key players in the industry, the Halal Expo Philippines aims to position the country as a leading hub for Halal products and services, driving economic growth and prosperity in the region.

The Halal Expo Philippines, a collaboration of the Department of Trade and Industry and Canada, intends to create up to P230-Billion in investments when it launches in the last quarter of 2024.

item.title: Quiboloy arrest warrant a court matter, says NSA Año
item.content:encoded: ''Wala, it's the court eh.'' This was the response of NSA Eduardo Año when asked about the administration's position on the warrant of arrest against Pastor Apollo Quiboloy.

item.title: Consultations on peace talks with NDFP ongoing, says Galvez
item.content:encoded: Presidential Peace Adviser Carlito Galvez Jr. said Thursday that consultations are still ongoing regarding peace negotiations with the National Democratic Front of the Philippines (NDFP).

item.title: DA fish import suspension order to raise canned mackerel prices, business exec warns
item.content:encoded: An official of the Canned Sardines Association of the Philippines warned Thursday that prices of canned mackerel may increase following the directive of the Department of Agriculture (DA) to suspend the issuance of import clearances for galunggong or round scad, mackerel, and bonito.

item.title: MMDA reiterates e-trikes, e-bikes ban on NCR national roads starting April 15
item.content:encoded: Starting April 15, tricycles, pushcarts, pedicabs, kuligligs, e-bikes, e-trikes, and light electric vehicles are banned on national roads in Metro Manila.

item.title: Taiwan condemns 'shameless" China for accepting world"s concern on quake
item.content:encoded: Taiwan condemned China as "shameless" after a Beijing envoy thanked the world for its concern about the earthquake. China claims Taiwan as its territory and the right to speak for it.

item.title: Gatchalian not going along with Cha-cha with term extensions
item.content:encoded:
Senator Sherwin Gatchalian, charter change, Cha-cha, political provisions, amendments
Senator Sherwin Gatchalian has expressed his opposition to talks of charter change (Cha-cha) if political provisions are to be amended. He believes that such changes could potentially jeopardize the country's democratic system and lead to power grabs by politicians. Gatchalian asserts that any revisions to the constitution should focus on economic and social reforms rather than altering political structures. He emphasizes the need for transparency and consultation with the public before any changes are made to the constitution. Gatchalian's stance reflects concerns about the potential consequences of using Cha-cha to consolidate power or undermine democratic processes in the Philippines. Critics of charter change argue that the process could be used to benefit specific political interests rather than serving the needs of the broader population. Gatchalian's call for a halt to discussions on Cha-cha if political provisions are in question underscores the importance of upholding democratic principles and protecting the interests of the Filipino people.

Summary: Senator Sherwin Gatchalian opposes charter change if political provisions are amended, expressing concerns about potential threats to democracy and power consolidation. He advocates for focusing on economic and social reforms rather than altering political structures, emphasizing the importance of transparency and public consultation. Gatchalian's stance reflects worries about the misuse of Cha-cha for political gain and calls for protecting democratic processes in the Philippines.

For Senator Sherwin Gatchalian, talks of charter change (Cha-cha) should be stopped if political provisions are amended.

item.title: Marcos declares April 10 a holiday to mark Eid'l Fitr
item.content:encoded:
President Ferdinand 'Bongbong' Marcos Jr., April 10, 2024, regular holiday, Eid'l Fitr, Feast of Ramadhan President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. has declared April 10, 2024, as a regular holiday nationwide in honor of Eid'l Fitr, also known as the Feast of Ramadhan. This significant Muslim celebration marks the end of Ramadan, the Islamic holy month of fasting. By declaring April 10 as a regular holiday, Filipinos across the country have the opportunity to join our Muslim brothers and sisters in their joyous festivities and observe this important religious occasion. The decision reflects a commitment to promoting unity and understanding among diverse cultural and religious communities in the Philippines. It is a gesture of respect and solidarity towards the Muslim population, recognizing and honoring their traditions and beliefs. This holiday serves as a meaningful opportunity for Filipinos to learn more about Islamic culture and traditions, fostering mutual respect and appreciation among different faiths in our nation.

Summary: President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. has declared April 10, 2024, a regular holiday nationwide in observance of Eid'l Fitr, also known as the Feast of Ramadhan, to promote unity, understanding, and respect for the Muslim community in the Philippines.

President Ferdinand ''Bongbong'' Marcos Jr. has declared April 10, 2024 as a regular holiday throughout the country in observance of Eid"l Fitr or the Feast of Ramadhan.

item.title: Former ISAFP chief Victor Corpus passes away at 79
item.content:encoded:
Philippines, ISAFP, Victor Corpus, chief, passed away Summary: Former Intelligence Service of the Armed Forces of the Philippines (ISAFP) chief Brig. Gen. Victor Corpus, aged 79, has passed away.

Former Intelligence Service of the Armed Forces of the Philippines (ISAFP) chief Brig. Gen. Victor Corpus has passed away. He was 79.

item.title: SC allows courts to observe flexible work arrangement due to heat

item.content:encoded: The Department of Public Works and Highways (DPWH) will conduct road reblocking and repairs until next week, the Metropolitan Manila Development Authority (MMDA) said Thursday.

item.content:encoded: Senator Raffy Tulfo does not want to run for president in 2028, his brother and House Deputy Majority Leader and ACT-CIS party-list lawmaker Erwin Tulfo said Thursday.

item.title: Apollo Quiboloy, hinahanap pa rin para arestuhin; 2 pa niyang kapuwa akusado, sumuko sa NBI
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Pastor Apollo Quiboloy, personal assistant, surrender, National Bureau of Investigation, Region 11 Summary: Two personal assistants of Pastor Apollo Quiboloy surrendered to the National Bureau of Investigation in Region 11, but the religious leader himself remains elusive. The assistants turned themselves in on Thursday, possibly in connection with an ongoing investigation. It is unclear why they chose to surrender at this time or what specific allegations they may be facing. The NBI is likely to conduct further inquiries and investigations to shed light on the situation. Despite the surrender of the assistants, Pastor Apollo Quiboloy has not been located, raising questions about his whereabouts and involvement in the matter. The case remains ongoing and more details are expected to emerge as the investigation progresses.

Summary: Two personal assistants of Pastor Apollo Quiboloy surrendered to NBI Region 11, but the religious leader remains missing. The circumstances surrounding their surrender and the specific reasons are still unclear. The NBI is likely to delve deeper into the matter. Quiboloy's whereabouts are currently unknown, prompting further questions about the situation. More information is anticipated as the investigation unfolds.

Dalawang personal assistant ni Pastor Apollo Quiboloy ang sumuko sa National Bureau of Investigation (NBI-Region 11) nitong Huwebes. Pero ang religious leader, hindi pa rin nakikita.

item.content:encoded:
San Bartolome, Quezon City, lalaki, CEO, pharmaceutical company Summary: A man accused of being involved in the killing of a pharmaceutical company CEO in 2022 has been apprehended in San Bartolome, Quezon City.

item.title: MIAA conducting maintenance power shutdowns at NAIA T3
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: MIAA, power maintenance, activities, NAIA Terminal 3 Summary: The Manila International Airport Authority (MIAA) is currently undertaking a series of power maintenance activities at Ninoy Aquino International Airport (NAIA) Terminal 3. This maintenance work is crucial for ensuring the efficient and safe operation of the terminal. The activities are likely to cause some disruptions in the terminal's operations, so passengers are advised to plan their travel accordingly. By conducting these power maintenance activities, MIAA aims to enhance the overall infrastructure and facilities at NAIA Terminal 3, ultimately improving the passenger experience and safety standards. It is essential for travelers to stay informed and stay updated on any announcements regarding the maintenance schedule to avoid any potential inconveniences during their travels.

Summary: The MIAA is conducting power maintenance activities at NAIA Terminal 3 to enhance infrastructure and ensure safe operations. Passengers should be prepared for potential disruptions and stay updated on any schedule changes to avoid inconveniences during their travels.

MIAA is conducting a series of power maintenance activities at the NAIA Terminal 3.

item.content:encoded: NLEX and SLEX are eyeing to have barrier-less entry points by November to ease traffic jams, House Deputy Majority Leader Erwin Tulfo said Thursday.
