item.title: BuCor: 10K PDLs to benefit from inclusion of heinous crimes to GCTA
item.content:encoded:
Supreme Court, PDLs, BuCor, heinous crimes, GCTA Summary: The Bureau of Corrections (BuCor) announced that around 10,000 persons deprived of liberty (PDLs) are set to benefit from the recent Supreme Court ruling. This ruling grants PDLs convicted of heinous crimes the right to the good conduct time allowance (GCTA). It is expected that this decision will have a significant impact on a large number of PDLs across the country. The BuCor highlighted that this entitlement will apply to PDLs who have been convicted of serious offenses but have shown good conduct during their time in prison. This move by the Supreme Court is aimed at potentially reducing the sentences of PDLs who have demonstrated positive behavior while serving their time. The decision emphasizes the importance of acknowledging good conduct and allowing for the possibility of rehabilitation and reintegration for PDLs back into society.

At least 10,000 persons deprived of liberty (PDLs) are expected to benefit from the ruling of the Supreme Court that PDLs convicted of heinous crimes are entitled to the good conduct time allowance (GCTA), the Bureau of Corrections (BuCor) said Thursday.

item.title: Babae, patay nang pagbabarilin sa loob ng bahay sa Maynila
item.content:encoded:
Tondo, Maynila, babae, pagpatay, barangay Summary: A woman was shot and killed inside their home in Tondo, Maynila. The family is puzzled by the murder as the victim had no negative record in the barangay.

Nasawi ang isang babae matapos pagbabarilin sa loob mismo ng kanilang bahay sa Tondo, Maynila. Ang pagpatay, palaisipan sa pamilya dahil wala umanong masamang record sa barangay ang biktima.

item.title: DPWH starts road repair, reblocking in parts of Roxas Boulevard
item.content:encoded:
reblocking, repairs, Roxas Boulevard, motorists, alternate routes Summary: Motorists in Roxas Boulevard were advised to use service roads and alternative lanes as the Department of Public Works and Highways initiated road reblocking and repairs. The repairs are expected to impact traffic flow along the affected areas, prompting the DPWH to recommend using alternate routes to mitigate congestion. The roadworks are crucial for maintaining the safety and functionality of Roxas Boulevard, a major thoroughfare in the area. By utilizing service roads and other lanes, motorists can navigate around the construction zones and reach their destinations efficiently. The DPWH's efforts aim to improve the overall road conditions and ensure the smooth operation of transportation in the vicinity.

Motorists were advised to use service roads and other lanes as alternate routes as the Department of Public Works and Highways start its road reblocking and repairs in parts of Roxas Boulevard.

item.title: Lalaking akyat-bahay, kumaripas ng takbo nang salubungin ng asong bantay
item.content:encoded: Kumaripas ng takbo ang isang lalaking nag-akyat-bahay matapos siyang salubungin ng asong bantay at ng mismong may-ari ng bahay sa San Carlos, Negros Occidental.

item.title: Magnitude-6.0 quake shakes northeast Japan, no tsunami alert
item.content:encoded:
Earthquake, Japan, Fukushima, magnitude-6.0, tsunami warning
A magnitude-6.0 earthquake struck off northeastern Japan's Fukushima region on Thursday, according to the Japan Meteorological Agency. The earthquake hit the Fukushima area, but fortunately, no tsunami warning was issued following the seismic activity. The quake occurred in the ocean off the coast and did not cause any immediate reports of major damage or casualties. The region has had a history of devastating earthquakes, with the 2011 Fukushima disaster being one of the most notable incidents. Despite the magnitude of the earthquake, the local authorities and residents were alert and prepared to respond to any potential threats. The monitoring systems put in place by the Japan Meteorological Agency played a crucial role in ensuring public safety during the seismic event.

Summary: - Magnitude-6.0 earthquake struck off Fukushima, Japan. - No tsunami warning was issued following the earthquake. - The quake occurred in the ocean off northeastern Japan. - No immediate reports of major damage or casualties. - Japan Meteorological Agency's monitoring systems helped ensure public safety.

A magnitude-6.0 earthquake struck off northeastern Japan's Fukushima region on Thursday, the Japan Meteorological Agency said, but no tsunami warning was issued.

item.title: Marcos wants holistic approach in solving PH's traffic woes --Balisacan
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: President Marcos, holistic approach, comprehensive, traffic problems, country Summary: President Marcos has emphasized the need for a holistic and comprehensive approach to solve the traffic problems in the country. He recognizes that the issue of traffic congestion requires a multifaceted solution that addresses the root causes and implements various strategies to improve the situation. By taking a holistic approach, the government can consider factors such as infrastructure development, public transportation systems, traffic management policies, and public awareness campaigns. This comprehensive strategy aims to create long-term and sustainable solutions to alleviate the traffic congestion that plagues many urban areas in the country. President Marcos believes that by addressing all aspects of the problem simultaneously, the government can make significant progress in easing traffic congestion and improving the overall quality of life for citizens. The commitment to a holistic and comprehensive approach reflects a proactive stance towards tackling one of the most pressing issues facing the country's urban centers.

Summary: President Marcos advocates for a holistic and comprehensive approach to address traffic problems, emphasizing the importance of considering various factors and implementing multiple strategies simultaneously.

President Marcos wants a holistic and comprehensive approach when it comes to solving traffic problems in the country

item.title: 2 of Quiboloy's personal assistants surrender to NBI
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Pastor Apollo Quiboloy, personal assistants, surrendered, National Bureau of Investigation, Thursday morning Summary: Two personal assistants of Pastor Apollo Quiboloy voluntarily turned themselves in to the National Bureau of Investigation on Thursday morning. The reason for their surrender was not immediately disclosed. The assistants' decision to surrender indicates their willingness to cooperate with the authorities in ongoing investigations. Pastor Apollo Quiboloy, a religious leader and founder of the Kingdom of Jesus Christ, has not commented on the situation at this time. It remains unclear what specific allegations or charges may be involved in this case. The NBI will likely conduct further inquiries to determine the nature of the assistants' involvement with Pastor Quiboloy. The surrender of the assistants could be a significant development in the investigation, shedding light on potential information related to Pastor Quiboloy or his organization. Further details are expected to emerge as the NBI continues its probe.

Summary: Two personal assistants of Pastor Apollo Quiboloy surrendered to the National Bureau of Investigation on Thursday morning, indicating their cooperation in ongoing investigations. The reason for their surrender and the specific nature of the case remain undisclosed, with Pastor Quiboloy yet to comment on the matter. The NBI will conduct further inquiries to determine the extent of the assistants' involvement, potentially uncovering crucial information related to Pastor Quiboloy or his organization.

Two of the personal assistants of Pastor Apollo Quiboloy surrendered to the National Bureau of Investigation 11 Thursday morning.

item.title: Water supply in Baguio threatened by decreasing reservoir levels
item.content:encoded: The water level in several reservoirs of the Baguio Water District (BWD) continues to decline due to the effects of El Niño.

item.title: DBM OKs release of P5.83B for construction of 1,834 new classrooms
item.content:encoded: The Department of Budget and Management (DBM) has approved the release of over P5 billion worth of public funds to finance the construction of more than one thousand classrooms all over the country.

item.title: China not among 14 observer countries in Balikatan 2024, says official
item.content:encoded:
China, Balikatan, observers, Philippines, United States
China will not be sending observers to this year's Balikatan, the annual joint military exercise between the Philippines and the United States. The exercise's executive agent, Colonel Michael Logico, confirmed this decision on Thursday. This marks a significant absence in the exercise, as China has traditionally sent observers to previous Balikatan exercises. The Balikatan exercise is an important event for the Philippines and the United States, showcasing their strong military alliance and partnership. The absence of Chinese observers may indicate tensions or strained relations between China and the participating countries. Despite China's absence, the Balikatan exercise is expected to proceed as planned, focusing on enhancing military cooperation and readiness between the Philippines and the United States.
Summary: China will not send observers to this year's Balikatan exercise with the Philippines and the United States, marking a departure from previous years. The absence of Chinese observers may signal strained relations between China and the participating countries. The Balikatan exercise is significant for showcasing the strong military alliance between the Philippines and the United States, emphasizing military cooperation and readiness.

China will not be sending observers in this year"s Balikatan or the annual joint military exercise of the Philippines and the United States, the exercise"s executive agent Colonel Michael Logico said Thursday.

item.title: Catapang orders prisons to ensure water supply amid extreme heat
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: BuCor chief, officials, prisons, penal farms, water supply Summary: BuCor chief Gregorio Catapang Jr. has directed all officials within prisons and penal farms across the country to ensure a consistent and adequate water supply for all Persons Deprived of Liberty (PDLs). This order is aimed at addressing the pressing need for access to clean water within the correctional facilities to maintain the health and well-being of the inmates. The directive emphasizes the importance of prioritizing the basic needs of PDLs, including water, to uphold their rights and dignity while serving their sentences. By mandating officials to take proactive measures in securing a steady water supply, the BuCor chief seeks to improve the living conditions and sanitation standards within the prison system. This initiative underscores the commitment of the agency to uphold humanitarian principles and ensure that PDLs are provided with essential resources for their daily needs.

BuCor chief Gregorio Catapang Jr. ordered all officials in prisons and penal farms nationwide to ensure that there is a steady supply of water for all PDLs.

item.title: Taiwan earthquake injuries top 1,000; hotel workers still missing
item.content:encoded:
Taiwan, earthquake, 7.2 magnitude, injured, 1,000

Over 1,000 individuals were injured in a powerful 7.2 magnitude earthquake that struck eastern Taiwan. The temblor caused widespread damage and triggered landslides, with several buildings collapsing and roads becoming impassable. The quake, which struck in the early hours of the morning, has left many residents displaced and in need of shelter. Rescue teams are working tirelessly to search for survivors amidst the rubble, with fears that the death toll may rise. The government has mobilized emergency response teams to provide assistance to those affected, and hospitals are struggling to accommodate the influx of injured individuals. The earthquake has caused chaos and devastation in the region, with infrastructure severely impacted. The full extent of the damage is still being assessed as the affected communities begin the process of recovery.

Summary:

The number of people injured in a 7.2 magnitude earthquake in eastern Taiwan climbed past 1,000 on Thursday.

item.title: Extreme heat affecting fishponds, seaweed farms in Zamboanga City
item.content:encoded:
Fishponds, seaweed farms, Philippines, El Niño, Zamboanga City Summary:

The extreme heat caused by El Niño in the Philippines is negatively impacting the production of fishponds and seaweed farms in Zamboanga City. The high temperatures have resulted in adverse conditions for these aquatic farms, leading to decreased productivity and potential financial losses for farmers. The situation highlights the vulnerability of agriculture to climate change and underscores the urgent need for adaptation strategies and support for affected communities. The harsh effects of El Niño on fishponds and seaweed farms underscore the importance of resilience and sustainability in the face of environmental challenges.

The extreme heat experienced across the Philippines because of El Niño is affecting the production of fishponds and seaweed farms in Zamboanga City.

item.title: UN Security Council fails to condemn strike on Iran in Syria
item.content:encoded:
United States, Britain, France, Russian, U.N. Security Council
Summary: The United States, Britain, and France opposed a Russian-drafted U.N. Security Council statement condemning an attack on Iran's embassy compound in Syria, blamed on Israel by Tehran. The statement was blocked by these countries, highlighting the complex dynamics in the region. The attack adds further tension to the already volatile situation in Syria, with Iran and Israel being longstanding rivals. The move to block the statement could signal underlying tensions between the countries involved in the conflict in Syria. The incident sheds light on the intricate diplomatic relationships at play in the region and the challenges faced in reaching a consensus on sensitive issues.

The United States, Britain and France on Wednesday opposed a Russian-drafted U.N. Security Council statement that would have condemned an attack on Iran's embassy compound in Syria, which Tehran has blamed on Washington's ally Israel.

item.title: World Central Kitchen founder: Israel targeted aid workers 'systematically, car by car'
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Jose Andres, celebrity chef, Gaza, food aid workers, Israeli attack Summary: Celebrity chef Jose Andres spoke to Reuters about an Israeli attack that killed seven of his food aid workers in Gaza. He described the attack as targeting the workers "systematically, car by car." This emotional interview highlighted the devastating impact of the violence in Gaza. Andres expressed his grief and outrage at the loss of his colleagues, emphasizing the need for humanitarian aid and support in the region. The incident underscores the ongoing conflict and tension in the Middle East, with civilian workers becoming casualties of the violence. Andres' testimony sheds light on the dangers faced by those providing essential assistance in conflict zones, calling attention to the need for greater protection and accountability in such situations.

Celebrity chef Jose Andres told Reuters in an emotional interview on Wednesday that an Israeli attack that killed seven of his food aid workers in Gaza had targeted them "systematically, car by car."

item.title: Chinese fugitives found at Tarlac scam hub
item.content:encoded:
Chinese, Philippine, Offshore Gaming Operator (POGO), workers, raided
Summary: Six Chinese nationals working for a Philippine Offshore Gaming Operator (POGO) were discovered to be fugitives with pending charges in China. The individuals were part of a raid on a scam hub in Bamban, Tarlac. The workers were found to have outstanding warrants in their home country, suggesting potential involvement in criminal activities. The incident highlights the challenges and risks associated with the POGO industry, including implications for cross-border law enforcement cooperation. This case serves as a reminder of the importance of thorough background checks and monitoring of foreign nationals working in sensitive industries like offshore gaming.

Six Chinese Philippine Offshore Gaming Operator (POGO) workers who were earlier raided in a scam hub in Bamban, Tarlac were found to be fugitives facing charges in their country.

item.title: Erwin Tulfo leads OCTA Research senatorial survey
item.content:encoded:
Representative Erwin Tulfo, ACT-CIS party-list, Senator, Tugon ng Masa Survey, OCTA Research

In the latest Tugon ng Masa (TNM) National Survey by the OCTA Research group, Representative Erwin Tulfo emerged as the top choice for Senator. His affiliation with the ACT-CIS party-list likely contributed to his popularity among survey respondents. The survey results indicate a strong level of support for Tulfo's bid for a Senate seat, reflecting his growing influence and recognition among the public. As a prominent figure in the media industry, Tulfo's candidacy is generating significant interest and discussion in political circles. His leadership and advocacy on key issues have resonated with the Filipino electorate, positioning him as a viable candidate for the upcoming elections. With his track record and public visibility, Tulfo is poised to make a significant impact in the Senate if elected. Overall, the survey highlights Tulfo's growing prominence and the public's receptiveness to his potential candidacy.

Summary: Representative Erwin Tulfo of the ACT-CIS party-list emerged as the top choice for Senator in the TNM survey by OCTA Research. His strong support reflects his growing influence and public recognition, particularly in media circles. Tulfo's leadership and advocacy on key issues have resonated with voters, positioning him as a formidable candidate for the upcoming elections. With his track record and visibility, Tulfo is poised to make a significant impact in the Senate if elected.

ACT-CIS party-list Representative Erwin Tulfo is the top choice as Senator in the latest Tugon ng Masa (TNM) National Survey conducted by the OCTA Research group.

item.title: US, Japan and Philippines to seek closer coordination on South China Sea --US official
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: trilateral summit, US, Japan, Philippines, South China Sea, coordination

Summary: Next week, a trilateral summit involving the US, Japan, and the Philippines will focus on enhancing coordination on South China Sea issues. Deputy Secretary of State Kurt Campbell highlighted the importance of this summit in strengthening the alliances and partnerships within the region. The collaboration between the three countries aims to address concerns related to the South China Sea and promote stability and security in the area. The discussions during the summit are expected to include various topics such as maritime security, freedom of navigation, and respect for international law. By coming together at this summit, the US, Japan, and the Philippines aim to demonstrate a united front in dealing with challenges in the South China Sea region and uphold a rules-based international order.

A trilateral summit next week between the US, Japan and the Philippines will bring closer coordination on South China Sea issues, US Deputy Secretary of State Kurt Campbell said on Wednesday.

item.title: SC: Pagbasura ni ex-Pres. Duterte sa amnestiya ni Trillanes, labag sa Konstitusyon
item.content:encoded:
Supreme Court, en banc decision, amnestiya, Antonio Trillanes IV, unconstitutional Summary: The Supreme Court, in an en banc decision, declared that the amnesty granted to former Senator Antonio Trillanes IV is valid. Alongside this, the highest court also ruled that the proclamation made by former President Rodrigo Duterte to void the said amnesty is unconstitutional. The decision affirms Trillanes' right to the amnesty granted to him and asserts the limits of presidential power in revoking such grants. Trillanes, a vocal critic of Duterte, had been facing legal battles following the revocation of his amnesty in relation to his involvement in military uprisings against former President Gloria Macapagal Arroyo. The Supreme Court's ruling brings a significant legal victory for Trillanes and highlights the importance of upholding constitutional processes in matters of amnesty and presidential powers.

Idineklara ng Korte Suprema sa en banc decision na may bisa ang amnestiya na ibinigay kay dating senador Antonio Trillanes IV. Kasabay nito, nagpasya rin ang kataas-taasang hukuman na "unconstitutional" ang proklamasyon na ginawa ni dating pangulong Rodrigo Duterte para ibasura ang naturang amnestiya.

item.title: UK faces pressure to stop selling weapons to Israel after aid workers killed
item.content:encoded: British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak is facing growing political pressure to stop selling weapons to Israel after seven aid workers, including three British nationals, were killed by an Israeli airstrike in Gaza.

item.title: Man nabbed for allegedly raping minor stepdaughter since 2015
item.content:encoded: A man was arrested in Quezon for allegedly raping his minor stepdaughter since 2015.

item.title: NATO to plan long-term Ukraine aid, mulls €100-billion fund
item.content:encoded:
agreed, NATO allies, long term military support, Ukraine, proposal
Summary: NATO allies have agreed to begin planning for long-term military support for Ukraine. NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg proposed a €100-billion ($107-billion) five-year fund for this purpose, but the response to this proposal was mixed. While some supported the idea, others had reservations. The fund would provide significant financial assistance to Ukraine for its defense needs over the next five years. This support would strengthen Ukraine's position against external threats and contribute to stability in the region. The agreement to initiate planning indicates a commitment among NATO allies to bolster Ukraine's defense capabilities in the face of ongoing security challenges. NATO's involvement in providing long-term military support demonstrates the alliance's solidarity with Ukraine and its dedication to promoting security and stability in Eastern Europe.

NATO allies agreed on Wednesday to initiate planning on long term military support for Ukraine, but a proposal by NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg to do so via a €100-billion ($107-billion) five-year fund drew mixed responses.

item.title: Warrant of arrest served vs. Quiboloy, 5 others
item.content:encoded:
issued, arrest, Pastor Apollo Quiboloy, Davao City Regional Trial Court, served Summary: The warrant of arrest issued by the Davao City Regional Trial Court against Pastor Apollo Quiboloy and five others has been served. This development indicates that the legal process is advancing in the case involving Pastor Quiboloy and his associates. The warrant, which was issued by the court, is a significant step in the legal proceedings against them. It signifies that the authorities are actively pursuing the case and ensuring that the individuals involved are held accountable for their actions. The serving of the warrant underscores the seriousness of the charges and the commitment of the court to uphold the rule of law. As Pastor Quiboloy and the other accused individuals now face the consequences of the legal action against them, the legal system is functioning as intended, ensuring that justice is served.

Summary:

The warrant of arrest issued by the Davao City Regional Trial Court against Pastor Apollo Quiboloy and five others have been served.

item.title: Heinous crimes convicts entitled to good conduct time allowance --SC
item.content:encoded:
convicted, heinous crimes, benefit, law, GCTA
Summary:
The Supreme Court has ruled that individuals convicted of heinous crimes are still entitled to benefit from the law that allows for the reduction of prison sentences through good conduct time allowance (GCTA). This decision means that even those who have committed serious offenses may have their prison terms shortened if they exhibit good behavior while incarcerated. The court's ruling emphasizes the importance of upholding the rights of all individuals, regardless of the nature of their crimes. It also highlights the rehabilitation-focused approach of the justice system, recognizing that demonstrating positive behavior and progress while serving a sentence should be taken into account when determining the appropriate length of imprisonment. Ultimately, the SC's decision ensures that even those convicted of heinous crimes have the opportunity to demonstrate their capacity for rehabilitation and potentially reintegrate into society sooner through adherence to the law.

Persons convicted of heinous crimes are entitled to benefit from the law that shortens the prison terms of inmates through the good conduct time allowance (GCTA), the Supreme Court (SC) said.

item.title: Misis ng pasyenteng namatay, 'di raw pinayagang makaalis ng ospital dahil 'di pa bayad ang bills
item.content:encoded: Inirereklamo ang isang pribadong ospital sa Valenzuela City dahil sa tila "palit-ulo" umano na sistema nito kapag namatay ang pasyente at hindi mabayaran ang bills. Para mailabas ang bangkay ng pasyente, may kaanak ito na maiiwan sa ospital at hindi palalabasin hangga't hindi naaayos ang dapat bayaran.

item.title: Many patients of destroyed Gaza hospital will die if not evacuated, WHO chief warns
item.content:encoded: The destruction of Al Shifa Hospital in Gaza will require more medical evacuations and ultimately cause more deaths if these are not carried out swiftly, the head of WHO said on Wednesday.

item.title: Cyberattack locks DOST out of system, hackers steal 2TB worth of data
item.content:encoded: The Department of Science and Technology  (DOST) confirmed that at least two terabytes of data have been compromised in a cyberattack by local hackers on Tuesday.

item.title: Outcry after Ghana traditional priest marries child
item.content:encoded: A traditional animist priest in Ghana has sparked a national outcry after marrying a young girl, prompting calls for his arrest.

item.title: US pushes back on judge over Trump claim that classified records he kept were personal
item.content:encoded: US Special Counsel Jack Smith pushed back on a federal judge after she signaled she may accept the former president's claim that the records were his personal property.

item.title: SC: Trillanes amnesty valid; ex-Pres. Duterte's revocation unconstitutional
item.content:encoded: The Supreme Court (SC), in an en banc decision, affirmed that the amnesty granted to former senator Antonio Trillanes IV is valid and that Proclamation No. 527 issued by former president Rodrigo Duterte revoking it is "unconstitutional."

item.title: Comelec urges changes to party-list law as political families find their way into system
item.content:encoded: Comelec Chairman George Garcia said Congress should amend the Party-list Law to prevent political families and power brokers from abusing loopholes and easing out genuine representatives of the marginalized sector.

item.title: Palace announces new appointees to various govt agencies
item.content:encoded: President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. assigned new officials to 17 different government agencies on Wednesday.

item.title: Residents affected by railway project to be relocated
item.content:encoded: Residents who would be affected by the North-South Commuter Railway Project (NCSR) are dreading their impending relocation, according to a "24 Oras" report by Joseph Morong.

item.title: 33-anyos na barangay kagawad at 22-anyos na SK chairperson, huli na magkasama sa kuwarto ng motel sa Cebu
item.content:encoded: Huli pero hindi kulong ang isang 33-anyos na kagawad ng barangay at 22-anyos na Sangguniang Kabataan (SK) chairwoman kahit naaktuhan silang magkasama sa loob ng kuwarto ng isang motel sa Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu.

item.title: 6k Iloilo farmers affected by dry season receive aid from GMA Kapuso Foundation
item.content:encoded:
farmers, Anilao, Banate, Iloilo, GMA Kapuso Foundation Summary: The GMA Kapuso Foundation has provided assistance to 6,000 farmers in Anilao and Banate, Iloilo, who have been affected by the ongoing dry season. The foundation's support comes at a critical time as these farmers rely on their agricultural activities for their livelihoods. With the help from GMA Kapuso Foundation, these farmers are able to receive much-needed aid to sustain their families during this challenging period. This initiative showcases the foundation's commitment to helping communities in need, particularly during times of crisis.

A total of 6,000 farmers from Anilao and Banate, Iloilo are among the recent recipients of help from GMA Kapuso Foundation as the dry season continues to affect their livelihoods.

item.title: No winners of Mega Lotto 6/45, Grand Lotto 6/55 on Wednesday
item.content:encoded:
lotto, draws, winners, April 3, 2024 Summary:
There were no winners in the big lotto draws held on Wednesday, April 3, 2024. This news comes as disappointment to those hoping to strike it lucky. The lack of winners means that the jackpot prize will roll over to the next draw, likely increasing in value. Participants will have another chance to try their luck in the upcoming lotto draws. The results of the draws highlight the unpredictable nature of such games of chance, emphasizing the element of luck involved in winning. Despite the outcome, the excitement and anticipation surrounding the lotto draws remain high, drawing in hopeful participants eager for a shot at the prize. This result serves as a reminder that winning the lottery is a rare and elusive occurrence, but the possibility of hitting the jackpot keeps players coming back for more.
Summary:

There were no winners of either of the big lotto draws held on Wednesday, April 3, 2024.

item.title: Heat, overcrowding pose health risks for PDLs in city jails
item.content:encoded:
extreme heat, overcrowding, health risks, persons deprived of liberty, city jails Summary: Extreme heat and overcrowding in city jails pose significant health risks for persons deprived of liberty (PDLs) in the country. According to a report by Maki Pulido on 24 Oras, the conditions in these jails are critical, with PDLs facing potential health hazards due to the lack of proper ventilation and space. The extreme heat exacerbates the overcrowding issue, leading to a high risk of heat-related illnesses and other health problems among the inmates. The situation requires immediate attention and intervention to ensure the safety and well-being of PDLs in city jails.

The extreme heat and overcrowding pose health risks for persons deprived of liberty (PDLs) in the country's city jails, according to Maki Pulido's 24 Oras report on Wednesday.

item.title: 2 senators favor demolition of Chocolate Hills resort
item.content:encoded: At least two senators on Wednesday said that they are in favor of demolishing the resort that was illegally constructed in the Chocolate Hills protected area in Bohol.

item.title: Tsunami warning after Taiwan quake sent residents fleeing, caused class suspensions
item.content:encoded: Residents on the coast of Pagudpud, Ilocos Norte went to evacuation centers after the Phivolcs raised a tsunami warning on Wednesday morning.

item.title: Death toll from Taiwan quake rises to 9; at least 50 missing
item.content:encoded: The death toll from Taiwan's biggest earthquake in at least 25 years has risen to at least nine people, with more than 900 injured and 50 hotel workers missing en route to a national park, authorities said, as rescuers used ladders to bring others to safety.

item.title: Parte ng katawan ng tao, nakita muli sa Cavite-Laguna Expressway sa Silang, Cavite
item.content:encoded:
Expressway, Cavite-Laguna, Silang, human body parts, discovery Summary: Human body parts were found in a section of the Cavite-Laguna Expressway in Silang, Cavite. The discovery has raised concerns and prompted an investigation into the incident. The authorities are working to determine the identity of the individual to which the body parts belong and the circumstances surrounding their presence on the expressway. The discovery has caused shock and alarm among local residents and commuters who use the expressway. The investigation is ongoing, and efforts are being made to gather further evidence and information to solve the mystery of how the human body parts ended up in that location.

May mga bahagi na naman ng katawan ng tao ang nakita sa bahagi ng Cavite-Laguna Expressway sa Silang, Cavite.

item.title: Tariff Commission ends public hearing on EO12 revision
item.content:encoded:
Executive Order No. 12, Tariff Commission, public hearing, review, NEDA Summary:

The Tariff Commission has concluded its public hearing on the mandatory review of Executive Order No. 12. Despite this, they will continue to gather additional data before presenting their final report to the National Economic and Development Authority (NEDA). The commission has been analyzing the implications of the executive order and will ensure all relevant information is considered before finalizing their recommendations. The process is crucial for informing policy decisions related to tariffs and trade regulations. The commission's dedication to thorough research and analysis demonstrates their commitment to making well-informed and impactful suggestions to aid economic development and trade in the country.

The Tariff Commission has ended its public hearing on the mandatory review of Executive Order No. 12 but it will continue to gather more data before submitting its final report to the National Economic and Development Authority (NEDA).

item.title: Tila anino na nakitang nasa bubungan ng isang paaralan sa Toril, nagdulot ng takot sa mga tao
item.content:encoded:
Barangay, Toril, Davao City, anino, aswang
Residents of a barangay in Toril, Davao City were struck with fear and confusion when they captured on camera what appeared to be a shadowy figure on the roof of a school late at night. The sight left them wondering whether it was a human or a supernatural creature like an aswang. The incident sparked discussions and speculation among the residents, with some believing it to be a paranormal entity while others dismissed it as a trick of the light. Despite attempts to debunk the sighting, the fear persisted in the community, leading to a sense of unease and mystery surrounding the strange occurrence. As the locals grappled with their beliefs and fears, the question of the identity of the figure remained unanswered, leaving them to ponder the existence of otherworldly beings in their midst.

Summary: Residents of a barangay in Toril, Davao City captured a shadowy figure on the roof of a school late at night, sparking fear and speculation about whether it was a human or a supernatural entity like an aswang. The incident led to discussions and unease in the community, with some believing in the paranormal while others sought rational explanations. The unresolved question of the figure's identity left the residents pondering the existence of otherworldly beings in their midst.

Nagdulot ng takot at naging palaisipan sa mga residente sa isang barangay sa Toril, Davao City ang nahuli-cam nilang tila anino na nasa bubungan ng isang paaralan sa dis-oras ng gabi. Ang tanong nila, tao kaya ang kanilang nakita o kakaibang nilalang, gaya ng aswang?

item.title: House education panel chair wants climate-resilient classrooms amid extreme heat
item.content:encoded:
classrooms, Philippine schools, extreme heat, retrofit, climate-resilient Summary:

A House leader in the Philippines emphasized the unpreparedness of classrooms in Philippine schools for the current extreme heat conditions, suggesting the urgent need for retrofitting to enhance climate resilience. The official highlighted the necessity of making school facilities more adaptable to extreme weather patterns to ensure a conducive learning environment for students. Retrofitting efforts should be prioritized to address the challenges posed by rising temperatures and improve the overall comfort and safety of students and teachers. It is crucial to invest in retrofitting initiatives to mitigate the impact of extreme heat on classroom conditions and create a more sustainable educational infrastructure. This call for climate-resilient measures in schools underscores the importance of proactive strategies to tackle the effects of climate change and ensure the well-being of students and educators.

Summary:

A House leader on Wednesday said that classrooms in Philippine schools are not ready for the extreme heat being experienced now, and should be retrofitted in order to be more climate-resilient.

item.title: Senators slam DENR exec's absence when PAMB cleared Chocolate Hills resort
item.content:encoded:
Department of Environment and Natural Resources, DENR, Region VII, Protected Area Management Board, PAMB Summary: A former DENR regional executive director from Region VII faced criticism from three senators for admitting his absence during the issuance of a resolution allowing a resort construction in Chocolate Hills. The executive director's absence raised concerns about the transparency and legitimacy of the decision-making process within the PAMB. The senators expressed disapproval of the director's lack of presence during such a crucial decision that impacts a protected area. This incident highlights the need for accountability and proper oversight in ensuring the protection of natural resources and preserving the integrity of protected areas. The unresolved issues surrounding the resort construction in Chocolate Hills underscore the importance of upholding environmental regulations and ensuring that decisions are made with proper consideration for the environment's conservation.

A former Department of Environment and Natural Resources' (DENR) regional executive director for Region VII earned the ire of at least three senators after he admitted that he was not present when the Protected Area Management Board (PAMB) issued the resolution allowing the construction of a resort in Chocolate Hills.

item.title: Norway"s parliament receives bomb threat
item.content:encoded:
bomb threat, Norway parliament, police, security, streets
Summary: Norway's parliament faced a bomb threat on Wednesday, prompting police to increase security and close off nearby streets. The threat was taken seriously, leading to heightened vigilance in the area to ensure the safety of those in and around the building. Authorities responded swiftly by blocking off streets surrounding the parliament building, containing the potential danger. The incident served as a reminder of the ongoing risks of security threats faced by governmental institutions, prompting a swift and thorough response from law enforcement. The situation was closely monitored as authorities worked to assess and address the threat while safeguarding the parliament and its occupants.

Norway's parliament received a bomb threat on Wednesday and police tightened security around the building, blocking off nearby streets.

item.title: Kalahok na nanalo ng bagong SUV, mahigit 2 araw na 'di inalis ang kamay sa sasakyan
item.content:encoded: May kakaibang pakontes na isinagawa sa Lipa City, Batangas kamakailan na ang premyo, bagong SUV na nagkakahalaga ng P1.8 milyon. Ang labanan, patagalan sa paghawak sa sasakyan na inabot ng mahigit dalawang araw. Sino kaya ang masuwerteng nagwagi?

item.title: Valenzuela hospital allegedly detained patients' kin for days over unpaid bills
item.content:encoded: Illegal detention charges were filed against a private hospital in Valenzuela City after it allegedly detained family members of patients who have yet to settle their medical bills, the local government said on Wednesday.

item.title: Philippines needs to vaccinate 22 million dogs to end rabies --DA
item.content:encoded: NUEVA ECIJA--The Philippines needs to vaccinate 22 million dogs to eradicate rabies across the country, Agriculture Secretary Francisco Tiu Laurel said on Wednesday.

item.title: Pope deplores deaths in Gaza and Ukraine from 'folly of war"
item.content:encoded: VATICAN CITY -- Pope Francis on Wednesday issued a fresh appeal for peace in Gaza and Ukraine, deploring the killing of aid workers in an Israeli airstrike and paying tribute to a Ukrainian soldier who died in the war against Russia.

item.title: Poll: Majority of Filipinos see easing of foreign investment restrictions will boost job quality in PH
item.content:encoded: Majority of Filipinos expressed belief that the removal of restrictions against foreign investments and businesses could lead to more high quality jobs

item.title: Lalaking naningil ng P100 na utang, tinaga sa Negros Occidental
item.content:encoded: Nagtamo ng sugat sa balikat ang isang lalaki matapos siyang tagain ng ama ng lalaking kaniyang sinisingil sa utang na nagkakahalaga ng P100 sa Talisay City, Negros Occidental.

item.title: Cambodia"s ex-leader Hun Sen becomes Senate president
item.content:encoded: Former Cambodian leader Hun Sen was promoted to senate president on Wednesday, taking over a key ceremonial role less than a year after handing power to his son.

item.title: Navy increases proposed number of small bases to 28
item.content:encoded: Navy increases proposed number of small bases to 28.

item.title: Finland mourns 12-year-old boy killed in school shooting
item.content:encoded: Flags flew at half-mast across Finland on Wednesday as the country mourned a 12-year-old boy who was killed in a school shooting, with police saying a fellow sixth-grader was their only suspect.

item.title: Mga Pinoy sa Taiwan, ligtas mula sa lindol--MECO
item.content:encoded:
Taiwan, earthquake, Philippines, MECO, casualties Summary: The Manila Economic and Cultural Office (MECO) reported that as of now, there have been no reported injuries or fatalities among Filipinos affected by the 7.2 magnitude earthquake that struck Taiwan on Wednesday. The earthquake, with its epicenter in Taiwan, did not cause any harm to Filipino nationals according to MECO. The report indicates that there have been no casualties or injuries amongst the Filipino community in Taiwan. MECO has been closely monitoring the situation and ensuring the safety of Filipinos residing in Taiwan. The earthquake, although powerful, did not result in any harm to Filipinos in the affected region. The swift response from MECO has been instrumental in safeguarding the well-being of Filipinos amidst the natural disaster. It is a relief that no Filipino nationals have been reported as injured or deceased due to the earthquake in Taiwan. The proactive measures taken by MECO have been effective in preventing any harm to the Filipino community in the area.

Wala pang naiuulat na mga Pilipino na nasaktan o nasawi sa pagtama ng 7.2 magnitude earthquake sa Taiwan nitong Miyerkoles, ayon sa Manila Economic and Cultural Office (MECO).

item.title: PCG: 1 injured as passenger vessel, barge collide in Isla Verde
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Isla Verde, Batangas, passenger vessel, barge, collision Summary: A collision between a passenger vessel and a barge off Isla Verde, Batangas has resulted in one person being injured. The incident occurred when the two vessels collided, causing damage to both and injuring one individual onboard the passenger vessel. The exact cause of the collision is currently unknown and an investigation is underway to determine the circumstances that led to the accident. The injured person was promptly treated for their injuries and is currently in stable condition. Authorities have yet to release further details regarding the incident, including the identities of those involved and the extent of the damages sustained by the vessels. The collision serves as a reminder of the importance of safety measures and vigilance while navigating the waters to prevent such accidents from occurring in the future.

Summary:

One person was injured after a passenger vessel and a barge collided off Isla Verde, Batangas.

item.title: 7.2 magnitude na lindol, tumama sa Taiwan; 4, patay
item.content:encoded:
magnitude, earthquake, Taiwan, casualties, injured Summary: Taiwan was struck by a powerful 7.2 magnitude earthquake, the strongest in 25 years, leading to the deaths of four individuals and leaving over 50 others injured. The earthquake caused widespread destruction and chaos on the island, with buildings collapsing and infrastructure damaged. Emergency services are working tirelessly to rescue those trapped under the rubble and provide assistance to the injured. The impact of the earthquake is significant, with many residents left homeless and in need of shelter. The Taiwanese government is coordinating relief efforts and assessing the extent of the damage to determine the next steps in the recovery process. The aftermath of the earthquake highlights the vulnerability of the island to natural disasters and the importance of preparedness in mitigating their impact. It is a somber reminder of the unpredictable and destructive power of earthquakes on communities and the urgent need for support and solidarity in times of crisis.

Summary:

Apat na ang naitalang nasawi at mahigit 50 iba pa ang sugatan matapos tumama ang 7.2 magnitude earthquake sa Taiwan nitong Miyerkoles, ang pinakamalakas na lindol na naranasan ng isla sa nakalipas na 25 taon.

item.title: BI intercepts foreigner linked to credit card fraud at NAIA
item.content:encoded: The Bureau of Immigration (BI) said Wednesday it prevented the entry of a Chinese national who is suspected of being involved in credit card fraud.

item.title: Seven dead, hundreds injured in most powerful Taiwan quake in 25 years
item.content:encoded: At least seven people were killed and more than 700 injured Wednesday by a powerful earthquake in Taiwan that damaged dozens of buildings and prompted tsunami warnings that extended to Japan and the Philippines before being lifted.

item.title: Gadon urges Congress to include political amendments in Cha-cha
item.content:encoded: Presidential Adviser for Poverty Alleviation Larry Gadon is urging Congress to include political amendments in the proposed Charter change.

item.title: Babaeng senior citizen, patay nang magulungan ng fuel truck sa Cavite
item.content:encoded: Nasawi ang isang babaeng senior citizen nang magulungan siya ng fuel truck sa Rosario, Cavite.

item.title: DA cracks down on illegal importers of galunggong, mackerel, bonito
item.content:encoded: The Department of Agriculture (DA) has issued a memorandum order suspending the issuance of sanitary and phytosanitary import clearances for galunggong or round scad, mackerel, and bonito after receiving reports that these fish imported for canning, processing, or institutional buyers are being diverted to wet markets.

item.title: Lalaki, timbog sa panggagahasa umano sa 14-anyos niyang anak-anakan sa QC
item.content:encoded: Sa kulungan ang bagsak ng isang lalaki dahil sa panggagahasa umano sa 14-anyos niyang anak-anakan sa Quezon City. Ang suspek, itinanggi ang mga paratang sa kaniya.

item.title: NFA has sufficient buffer stock amid closure of some warehouses --DA
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Philippines, buffer stock, rice requirement, sufficient, country Summary:

The Philippines currently has a significant buffer stock in place to meet the country's rice needs. This surplus is ample to fulfill the national requirement for rice, ensuring food security for its citizens. The adequate buffer stock provides a safety net against any potential disruptions in rice supply, such as natural disasters or market fluctuations. With these reserves in place, the Philippines is well-prepared to address any unforeseen challenges that may impact rice availability in the country. This surplus is a vital component of the nation's food security strategy, ensuring a stable and reliable supply of rice for its population.

Summary:

The Philippines has sufficient buffer stock to fulfill the country"s rice requirement

item.title: Magnitude 5.1 earthquake hits offshore Hinatuan, Surigao del Sur
item.content:encoded:
earthquake, Hinatuan, Surigao del Sur, magnitude 5.1, Wednesday afternoon
A magnitude 5.1 earthquake struck offshore east of Hinatuan, Surigao del Sur, on Wednesday afternoon. The earthquake was recorded by the Philippine Institute of Volcanology and Seismology. The epicenter was located in the vicinity of Hinatuan, a municipality in Surigao del Sur. The earthquake's magnitude was measured at 5.1, indicating a moderate seismic event. The tremor was felt in the surrounding areas, prompting heightened awareness and precautionary measures. The earthquake serves as a reminder of the region's susceptibility to seismic activity and the importance of preparedness and response protocols.

Summary:

A magnitude 5.1 earthquake struck offshore east of Hinatuan, Surigao del Sur on Wednesday afternoon, the Philippine Institute of Volcanology and Seismology reported.

item.title: 4 dead in Taiwan's strongest earthquake in 25 years
item.content:encoded:
Earthquake, Taiwan, 7.2 magnitude, 25 years, four people
Summary: - A powerful 7.2 magnitude earthquake struck Taiwan, marking the strongest tremor to hit the island in at least 25 years. - The earthquake caused the tragic death of four people as buildings and infrastructure were damaged in the aftermath of the quake. - The quake sent shockwaves across the region and prompted widespread concern for the safety and well-being of residents in Taiwan. - Rescue efforts and emergency response teams were deployed to assist those affected by the earthquake, as the community came together to support one another in the face of the disaster. - The earthquake serves as a reminder of the unpredictable nature of natural disasters and the importance of being prepared for such events in order to minimize loss of life and damage to property.

A 7.2 magnitude earthquake rocked Taiwan on Wednesday, the strongest tremor to hit the island in at least 25 years, killing four people.

item.title: Gov't agencies push for maritime zones bill
item.content:encoded: Government agencies on Tuesday called for the enactment of the Maritime Zones Bill which seeks to declare such areas in the country under Philippine jurisdiction.

item.title: Dating empleyado ng MTPB, huli matapos kikilan ang sinitang motorista sa Maynila
item.content:encoded: Sa kulungan ang bagsak ng isang lalaking dating empleyado ng Manila Traffic and Parking Bureau matapos niyang kikilan umano ang motorista na kaniyang sinita sa Maynila. Ang suspek, sinabing nagawa niya ang krimen dahil sa hirap ng buhay.

item.title: PDLs get sore eyes, 'pigsa' amid extreme heat -- BJMP
item.content:encoded: The Bureau of Jail Management and Penology (BJMP) on Wednesday said that persons deprived of liberty (PDLs) in several jails have contracted sore eyes and pigsa or boils amid the scorching heat currently affecting the country.

item.title: PH committed to maintaining position at Ayungin Shoal --security official
item.content:encoded:
resupply missions, soldiers, grounded warship, Second Thomas Shoal, South China Sea Summary:
- The Philippines will continue resupply missions to soldiers stationed in a grounded warship off Second Thomas (Ayungin) Shoal in the South China Sea. - The country's top security official confirmed the decision to provide ongoing support to the troops at the strategic location in the disputed waters of the South China Sea. - The resupply missions are crucial for ensuring the well-being and readiness of the soldiers stationed at the shoal, which serves as a vital outpost for the Philippines in the region. - The presence of Filipino troops at Second Thomas Shoal underscores the country's commitment to protecting its territorial interests and maintaining a strong presence in the face of competing claims in the area. - By continuing these missions, the Philippines demonstrates its determination to assert its sovereignty and uphold its security concerns in the South China Sea despite tensions with neighboring countries.
Summary:

The Philippines will continue resupply missions to soldiers stationed in a grounded warship off Second Thomas (Ayungin) Shoal in the South China Sea, a top security official said Wednesday.

item.title: Tsunami warning over Luzon areas after Taiwan quake now canceled --PHIVOLCS
item.content:encoded:
Taiwan, earthquake, tsunami warning, Luzon, canceled
The tsunami warning issued for four areas in northern Luzon following a magnitude 7.2 earthquake in Taiwan has been lifted by the Philippine Institute of Volcanology and Seismology. The earthquake had initially raised fears of a possible tsunami in the northern Luzon region, prompting warnings to be issued. However, the agency later confirmed that there was no longer a threat of a tsunami and canceled the warnings. The earthquake in Taiwan had a magnitude of 7.2 and was felt in various parts of Luzon. Despite the initial concerns, there were no reports of any significant damage or casualties resulting from the earthquake. Following the cancellation of the tsunami warnings, residents in the affected areas were advised to remain vigilant and monitor updates from the authorities.

Summary: - Taiwan was hit by a magnitude 7.2 earthquake. - Tsunami warnings were issued for four areas in northern Luzon. - The tsunami warnings have been canceled by the Philippine Institute of Volcanology and Seismology. - The earthquake did not result in any significant damage or casualties in Luzon. - Residents are advised to remain vigilant and monitor updates.

The tsunami warning issued for four areas in northern Luzon due to the magnitude 7.2 earthquake in Taiwan on Wednesday has been canceled, the Philippine Institute of Volcanology and Seismology said.

item.title: Davao court issues arrest warrant vs. Quiboloy
item.content:encoded:
warrant, arrest, Kingdom of Jesus Christ, Apollo Quiboloy, Davao court

The Davao court has issued a warrant of arrest against Apollo Quiboloy, the leader of the Kingdom of Jesus Christ. Quiboloy faces legal action due to reported criminal charges. The warrant signifies the court's order for law enforcement to take Quiboloy into custody, suggesting the severity of the allegations against him. As the leader of a religious organization, Quiboloy's legal troubles could have significant repercussions not only personally but also for his followers and the church he leads. It remains to be seen how this development will unfold and impact both Quiboloy and the Kingdom of Jesus Christ's operations. Despite the warrant being issued, Quiboloy may have legal avenues to challenge the charges and defend himself in the Philippines' judicial system.

Summary:

Davao court has issued a warrant of arrest against Kingdom of Jesus Christ leader Apollo Quiboloy.

item.title: DOH logs 84 rabies deaths so far in 2024
item.content:encoded: A total of 84 rabies cases, which all resulted in deaths, have been recorded from Jan. 1 to March 16, 2024, the Department of Health (DOH) said Wednesday.

item.title: Senate probe into 'gentleman's agreement' between Duterte, China sought
item.content:encoded: A resolution urging the Senate to investigate the supposed "gentleman's agreement" involving the administration of former President Rodrigo Duterte and the Chinese government has been filed.

item.title: DOH can't say pertussis situation is under control as cases continue to rise
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: transmission, whooping cough, pertussis, cases, vaccines Summary: The Department of Health (DOH) has expressed uncertainty about the management of the transmission of whooping cough, also known as pertussis, in the country. Despite efforts to control the spread of the disease, cases are still on the rise, and vaccine supplies are running low. The DOH is concerned about the ability to effectively manage the situation as the number of cases continues to increase. The depletion of vaccines adds to the challenge of controlling the spread of the disease. The DOH continues to monitor the situation closely but acknowledges that the current status is still uncertain. The increasing cases of whooping cough raise concerns about the effectiveness of existing measures to prevent the spread of the disease. The DOH is working to address the issue, but the situation remains uncertain. Vaccination efforts are crucial in managing the transmission of pertussis in the country.

Summary: The Department of Health is uncertain about managing the increasing cases of whooping cough and depletion of vaccines. Monitoring is ongoing, but the situation remains uncertain.

It is still not certain if the transmission of the “whooping cough” or pertussis in the country is already manageable as cases continue to increase and vaccines start to get depleted, the Department of Health (DOH) said Wednesday.

item.title: Tsunami warning up over 4 northern Luzon areas after Taiwan earthquake
item.content:encoded:
tsunami warning, northern Luzon, earthquake, Taiwan, PHIVOLCS
Summary:
A tsunami warning has been issued for four areas in northern Luzon following a powerful earthquake in Taiwan. The warning was announced by PHIVOLCS after the earthquake struck on Wednesday morning. The affected areas in Luzon are now on high alert for potential tsunamis. The earthquake in Taiwan has prompted concerns about the safety of coastal regions in the Philippines. Residents in the warned areas are urged to take precautionary measures and stay informed about the situation. The warning serves as a reminder of the unpredictability and potential dangers of natural disasters, emphasizing the importance of preparedness and swift action in response to such events.

A tsunami warning has been issued over four areas in northern Luzon following Wednesday morning's strong earthquake in Taiwan, PHIVOLCS said.

item.title: Negros Occidental man who lends P100 hacked for demanding payment
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: man, collect money, P100, borrower, hacked Summary: A man attempted to collect P100 from a borrower but was instead hacked in the process. The incident highlights the dangers of trying to enforce financial transactions in person, as it can lead to unexpected and harmful outcomes. The man's intention to retrieve the owed money turned into a hazardous situation as the borrower resorted to hacking as a means of defense or retaliation. This serves as a cautionary tale for individuals engaging in debt collection activities, emphasizing the importance of utilizing safe and legal methods. The incident underscores the risks associated with financial disputes and the potential for violence or criminal activity to arise. Overall, it serves as a reminder to prioritize personal safety and security when dealing with financial matters, to prevent falling victim to unforeseen circumstances.

Summary: A man who attempted to collect P100 from a borrower was hacked instead, highlighting the dangers of enforcing financial transactions in person. The borrower's resort to hacking as a means of defense or retaliation underscores the risks associated with debt collection activities, emphasizing the importance of utilizing safe and legal methods to avoid unforeseen harm. This incident serves as a cautionary tale regarding the potential for violence or criminal activity in financial disputes, emphasizing the need to prioritize personal safety and security in such situations.

A man who tried to collect money worth P100 from a borrower was hacked instead.

item.title: Dengue cases in Western Visayas increase to over 1,800 --DOH
item.content:encoded:
dengue, cases, Western Visayas, DOH, 1,800 Summary: Western Visayas has reported over 1,800 cases of dengue this year, according to the Department of Health (DOH) Western Visayas Center for Health Development - Dengue and Malaria Program. The region is facing a significant challenge in controlling the spread of the disease. The DOH is actively monitoring and responding to the situation to prevent further outbreaks. The high number of cases highlights the need for continued public awareness and preventive measures to combat dengue. The authorities are urging the public to take steps to eliminate mosquito breeding sites and protect themselves from mosquito bites to reduce the risk of contracting dengue.


Western Visayas has recorded more than 1,800 cases of dengue this year so far, according to the Department of Health (DOH) Western Visayas Center for Health Development - Dengue and Malaria Program.

item.title: Strong 7.2 magnitude earthquake hits Taipei
item.content:encoded:
earthquake, Taipei, Taiwan, magnitude 7.2, central weather administration
An earthquake with a magnitude of 7.2 struck the capital city of Taipei in Taiwan on Wednesday morning, according to the Taiwan central weather administration. The powerful quake caused significant concern and potential damage in the region.

TAIPEI -- An earthquake with a magnitude of 7.2 hit Taipei, the capital of Taiwan, on Wednesday morning, the Taiwan central weather administration said.

item.title: North Korea test-fires new solid-fuel hypersonic missile
item.content:encoded:
North Korea, test-fire, new missile, solid-fuel, hypersonic
Summary:
North Korea claimed to have successfully test-fired a new mid- to long-range solid-fuel hypersonic missile. The test was announced in the North Korean newspaper Rodong Sinmun. The missile is believed to be capable of reaching greater distances and traveling at faster speeds than traditional missiles. North Korea's continued development of advanced weaponry has raised concerns among the international community, particularly regarding the country's military capabilities and intentions. The test is likely to further escalate tensions in the region and prompt responses from neighboring countries and global powers.

North Korea said on Wednesday it successfully test-fired a new mid- to long-range solid-fuel hypersonic missile, North Korean newspaper Rodong Sinmun said.

item.title: 6 children dead, 14 injured in Iraq road accident
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: primary-school students, killed, refrigerator truck, Basra, Iraq Summary: Six primary-school students tragically lost their lives in Basra, Iraq, when a refrigerator truck swerved into a group of children, as reported by the Interior Ministry. In addition to the fatalities, 14 other students sustained injuries in the incident. The terrible accident occurred in the southern Iraqi city on Tuesday, shocking the community and prompting an outpouring of support for the affected families. The precise cause of the truck veering off course remains under investigation, as authorities work to determine the circumstances that led to this devastating outcome. The loss of young lives in this tragic event serves as a poignant reminder of the importance of road safety measures and vigilance, especially in areas frequented by children. The authorities are expected to conduct a thorough inquiry to prevent similar incidents in the future and ensure the safety of all residents, particularly the most vulnerable members of society.

Summary:

Six primary-school students were killed and 14 others were injured when a refrigerator truck veered into a group of children in the southern Iraqi city of Basra on Tuesday, the Interior Ministry said in a statement.

item.title: UAE pauses aid to Gaza by sea after Israeli strike kills aid workers
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: United Arab Emirates, humanitarian aid, maritime corridor, Gaza, Israel

The United Arab Emirates is halting its humanitarian aid efforts to Gaza through a maritime corridor from Cyprus due to safety concerns and the need for a thorough investigation into the deaths of aid workers in Gaza. The decision comes as the UAE seeks further safety guarantees from Israel before resuming aid shipments. The UAE official told Reuters on Tuesday that the pause in aid efforts is necessary to ensure the safety of aid workers and to address any potential risks in the region. The move highlights the importance of ensuring the safety of humanitarian workers in conflict zones like Gaza, where aid workers face significant risks while providing assistance to those in need. Overall, the UAE's decision reflects a commitment to prioritizing the safety and security of aid workers in challenging environments like Gaza.

Summary:

The United Arab Emirates is pausing humanitarian aid efforts through a maritime corridor from Cyprus to Gaza pending further safety guarantees from Israel and a full investigation into the deaths of aid workers in Gaza, a UAE official told Reuters on Tuesday.

item.title: Manny Villar, tanging Pinoy na pasok sa top 200 list ng pinakamayayamang tao sa mundo ng Forbes Magazine
item.content:encoded:
Forbes, Manny Villar, top 200, richest, Philippines Summary: As of 2024, Manny Villar remains the wealthiest individual in the Philippines and is the only Filipino to make it to the Forbes magazine's list of the top 200 richest people in the world. This achievement highlights Villar's immense success and financial standing within the global landscape. It also underscores the continued growth and prosperity of his business ventures, positioning him as a significant player in the international wealth ranking. Villar's persistent dedication to entrepreneurship and investment has enabled him to maintain a prominent position among the elite wealthy individuals worldwide. His presence on the prestigious Forbes list serves as a testament to his business acumen and ability to navigate the complexities of the global economy successfully.

Si dating Senate President Manny Villar pa rin ang pinakamayaman sa Pilipinas, at tanging Pinoy na pasok sa listahan ng Forbes magazine na top 200 na pinakamayayamang tao sa mundo ngayong 2024.

item.title: Bakit lumulubog pa rin sa baha ang Metro Manila kapag umulan kahit may mga flood control project?
item.content:encoded:
pumping station, Metro Manila, baha, pag-ulan, kontrol
Summary: Despite having a total of 52 pumping stations in Metro Manila to control the flow of water from rivers, estuaries, canals, and more, the region still experiences flooding during heavy rainfall. This raises the question of why the pumping stations are unable to prevent flooding effectively. The issue may stem from several factors, such as the capacity of the pumping stations not being sufficient to handle the volume of water during heavy downpours. Additionally, poor drainage systems and clogged waterways could impede the flow of water, leading to flooding in various parts of Metro Manila. Furthermore, urbanization and improper waste disposal practices contribute to the blockage of drainage systems, exacerbating the flooding problem in the region. Addressing these underlying issues and ensuring the proper maintenance and management of pumping stations are crucial to improving flood control measures in Metro Manila.

Lumalabas na mayroong kabuuang 52 pumping station sa Kamaynilaan upang makontrol ang pagdaloy ng mga tubig na mula sa mga ilog, estero, kanal at iba pa sa rehiyon. Ngunit sa kabila nito, bakit patuloy pa rin lumulubog sa baha ang Metro Manila kapag umulan?

item.title: Pulse Asia: Marcos approval down 13 points, Sara's by 7
item.content:encoded:
approval, trust, ratings, President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr., Pulse Asia Summary:

President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr.'s nationwide approval and trust ratings have decreased significantly in the latest Ulat ng Bayan survey conducted by Pulse Asia. The survey revealed a 13-point drop in his approval rating and a 16-point decrease in trust towards him among Filipinos. This decline may be indicative of growing dissatisfaction among the public with the president's leadership and policies. The survey results highlight the importance of continuous assessment of public opinion and feedback to address areas of concern and improve governance. The declining ratings could have potential implications for President Marcos Jr.'s future political standing and decisions as he navigates the challenges of leadership in the Philippines. It remains to be seen how the president will respond to these findings and whether he will take steps to regain the trust and approval of the Filipino people.

President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr.'s nationwide approval and trust ratings went down by 13 and 16 percentage points respectively, according to Pulse Asia's latest Ulat ng Bayan survey.

item.title: Biden speaks to China"s Xi on Taiwan, Ukraine, Philippines
item.content:encoded: US President Joe Biden and Chinese President Xi Jinping held their first direct talks on Tuesday, during which Biden was likely to warn Beijing over escalating confrontations in the South China Sea in conflict with international law.

item.title: Aspin na inaantok, kinagiliwan dahil sa kaniyang pagiging 'pabebe' sa amo
item.content:encoded:
Aspin, puppy eyes, netizens, Malibay, Pasay City

Netizens are enamored with an Aspin who put on a show of "puppy eyes" and acted like the best "aww-ctor" as it pretended to be cute when feeling sleepy in Malibay, Pasay City. The dog charmed the online community with its adorable antics and facial expressions, particularly its puppy eyes that tugged at heartstrings. The Aspin's cute behavior in trying to resist falling asleep garnered lots of attention and affection from netizens, who shared the heartwarming moment across various social media platforms. The incident took place in the bustling city of Malibay, Pasay, where the furry friend displayed its irresistible charm and endearing personality. Its playful and lovable demeanor made it a viral sensation online, capturing the hearts of people who couldn't help but gush over its cuteness. The Aspin's ability to connect with others through its innocent and captivating expressions made it a beloved figure on the internet, spreading joy and delight to everyone who came across its charming photos and videos.
Summary:
The Aspin in Malibay, Pasay City wins over netizens with its adorable "puppy eyes" and lovable personality, becoming a viral sensation online through its charming antics and heartwarming expressions.

Kinagiliwan ng netizens ang isang Aspin na todo-puppy eyes pa at tila best “aww-ctor” nang magpabebe ito matapos makaramdam ng antok sa Malibay, Pasay City.

item.title: World powers condemn deadly Israel air strike on aid workers in Gaza
item.content:encoded:
US, France, Britain, international criticism, Israeli strike
Summary:
The US, France, and Britain have led international criticism of a targeted Israeli strike in the Gaza Strip. The strike resulted in the death of seven charity staff who were unloading aid brought by sea to the war-torn territory. The aid was desperately needed in Gaza, making the loss of the charity staff even more tragic. The criticism from the three countries highlights the concern over the use of disproportionate force in conflict situations. The incident also raises questions about the safety of humanitarian workers operating in volatile regions like Gaza. The condemnation from these influential nations may put pressure on Israel to review its military strategies and prioritize the protection of civilians and aid workers in future operations.
Summary:

The US, France and Britain led international criticism of a "targeted Israeli strike" in the Gaza Strip that killed seven charity staff as they unloaded desperately needed aid brought by sea to the war-torn territory.

item.title: Tatay, todo hataw sa sayaw para mapatahan ang anak
item.content:encoded:
Indak, Ama, Baby, General Trias, Cavite Summary: The video of a father dancing to soothe his baby in General Trias, Cavite, has captured the hearts of netizens. The energetic dance moves of the father, who is seen swaying with his baby, have impressed many on social media. The video shows the father's creative and heartwarming way of calming his fussy baby, showcasing the strong bond between the two. The father's dedication to soothing his child has been widely praised online, with comments expressing admiration and joy for the sweet moment. This viral video serves as a reminder of the special moments shared between parents and their children, reinforcing the importance of love and care in family relationships.

Kinaaliwan ng netizens ang todo-hataw na pag-indak ng isang ama, na kaniyang paraan para mapatahan ang kaniyang baby sa General Trias, Cavite.

item.title: 2 drum na mga bangkay ng tao ang laman, natagpuan sa ilog sa Camarines Norte
item.content:encoded: Bumulaga ang dalawang bangkay na magkahiwalay na nakasilid sa dalawang drum na nakita sa ilog ng Labo, Camarines Norte.

item.title: Ukraine invites citizens to register wartime damage
item.content:encoded: Ukrainians can begin filing claims for damages they have suffered in Russia's invasion at a newly-established register based in The Hague, Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba said on Tuesday.

item.title: 53,000 people flee Haiti capital in three weeks of gang violence --UN
item.content:encoded: More than 50,000 people fled Port-au-Prince within three weeks last month as an explosion of gang violence shook the Haitian capital, the United Nations said Tuesday.

item.title: Pagsibak ng Ombudsman kay Cesar Chiong sa MIAA, binaliktad ng CA
item.content:encoded: Binaliktad ng Court of Appeals (CA) ang desisyon ng Office of the Ombudsman na sibakin sa puwesto si Cesar Chiong bilang dating general manager ng Manila International Airport Authority (MIAA).

item.title: DOH to monitor pertussis trends amid vaccination efforts
item.content:encoded: The Department of Health (DOH) will continue to monitor the spread of pertussis in the country following increased efforts for immunization against the disease.

item.title: Daytime fire at Istanbul nightclub kills at least 27 people
item.content:encoded: At least 15 people were killed and eight others were injured in a fire at a nightclub in central Istanbul during daytime repair work, city mayor Ekrem Imamoglu said on Tuesday.

item.title: Pulse Asia: Erwin Tulfo, Tito Sotto, Rodrigo Duterte top latest senatorial poll
item.content:encoded: ACT-CIS Rep. Erwin Tulfo has topped the latest senatorial preference survey conducted by Pulse Asia.

item.title: There were no lucky bettors of the major lotto draws held on Tuesday, April 2, 2024
item.content:encoded:
Super Lotto 6/49, Lotto 6/42, Ultra Lotto 6/58, Philippine Charity Sweepstakes Office, April 2, 2024
Summary: No bettors correctly guessed the winning combinations for the Super Lotto 6/49, Lotto 6/42, and Ultra Lotto 6/58 drawn by the Philippine Charity Sweepstakes Office on April 2, 2024. This means that there were no jackpot winners for these lottery games on that particular date. The lack of winners indicates that the prize money for each of the three lotteries will roll over to the next draw, leading to potentially higher jackpot amounts. The results were a disappointment for those who had placed their bets on these popular lottery games, as they missed out on the opportunity to claim the substantial winnings. The announcement of no winners serves as a reminder of the unpredictable nature of lottery games, where luck plays a significant role in determining the outcome. The next draws for the Super Lotto 6/49, Lotto 6/42, and Ultra Lotto 6/58 are expected to attract more participants as the jackpot prizes continue to grow.


No bettors guessed the right combinations for the Super Lotto 6/49, Lotto 6/42 and Ultra Lotto 6/58 drawn by the Philippine Charity Sweepstakes Office (PCSO) on April 2, 2024.

item.title: Pickpockets in Manila wipe out man's e-wallet, make online bank loan
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Thieves, Manila City, smartphone, e-wallet, online bank loan Summary: Thieves in Manila City targeted a pedestrian, stealing his smartphone and ransacking the money in his e-wallet. They went a step further by using the stolen device to make an online bank loan before ultimately fleeing the scene. The victim was left not only without his valuable belongings but also facing potential financial repercussions due to the unauthorized loan taken out in his name. This incident serves as a stark reminder of the dangers posed by thieves who not only steal physical items but also exploit digital avenues to commit further crimes. It highlights the need for increased vigilance and security measures to prevent such incidents from happening in the future. The authorities were alerted to the crime, but the thieves had already made their escape, leaving the victim to deal with the aftermath of their brazen actions. With the prevalence of technology in our daily lives, it is crucial to protect our devices and personal information to avoid falling victim to such malicious activities.

Summary: Thieves in Manila City stole a pedestrian's smartphone and e-wallet contents before using the device to make an unauthorized online bank loan, leaving the victim not only bereft of his belongings but also facing potential financial consequences.

Thieves in Manila City stole a pedestrian's smartphone, ransacked the money in his e-wallet, and used the device to make an online bank loan as a final deed.

item.title: Pulse Asia: Raffy Tulfo, Sara Duterte top latest presidential survey
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Senator Raffy Tulfo, Vice President Sara Duterte, statistical tie, Pulse Asia, presidential preference survey Summary: Senator Raffy Tulfo and Vice President Sara Duterte are in a statistical tie according to Pulse Asia's latest presidential preference survey. The survey results indicate a close race between the two prominent figures, with both receiving significant support from the public. The findings suggest that both Tulfo and Duterte are viable contenders in the upcoming presidential election, with a strong following among Filipino voters. The statistical tie highlights the competitive nature of the race and the potential for a close outcome. The survey results have implications for the political landscape in the Philippines and could influence decision-making among voters and political stakeholders. Overall, the survey underscores the significance of public opinion and the role it plays in shaping the country's future leadership.

Summary: Senator Raffy Tulfo and Vice President Sara Duterte are in a statistical tie in Pulse Asia's presidential preference survey, indicating a close race between the two figures with significant public support. Their competitiveness highlights the potential for a close outcome in the upcoming election, emphasizing the importance of public opinion in shaping the country's future leadership.

Senator Raffy Tulfo and Vice President Sara Duterte have figured in a statistical tie in Pulse Asia's latest presidential preference survey
