item.title: UN expert in Israel genocide accusation says she has been threatened
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: UN expert, report, genocide, Israel, Gaza Summary: A UN expert who published a report alleging that Israel may have committed genocide in Gaza revealed that she had received threats during her tenure. The expert's report concluded that there were reasonable grounds to believe that Israel had committed genocide in Gaza. The report stirred controversy and led to an increased level of scrutiny on Israel's actions in the region. The expert's findings also highlighted the ongoing conflict and human rights abuses in the Gaza Strip, shedding light on the need for further investigation and accountability. Despite facing threats and backlash for her report, the UN expert stood by her findings and called for action to address the issue of genocide in Gaza. The report's publication sparked debate and raised questions about the situation in Gaza, putting pressure on the international community to respond to the allegations of genocide.

Summary: A UN expert who released a report accusing Israel of potential genocide in Gaza has faced threats, sparking controversy and calls for action to address human rights abuses in the region.

A UN expert who published a report saying there were reasonable grounds to believe Israel has committed genocide in Gaza said she had received threats throughout her mandate.

item.title: Canada clocks fastest population growth in 66 years in 2023
item.content:encoded:
record high, population, Canada, immigration, growth
Canada's population reached a record high of 40.77 million in 2023, with a significant increase driven by temporary immigration. The country saw a growth of 1.27 million people, marking a 3.2% increase from the previous year and the highest growth rate since 1957. This surge in population can be attributed to the influx of immigrants coming to Canada. In recent years, Canada has been welcoming a large number of temporary immigrants, contributing to the overall population growth. This demographic shift has implications for various sectors such as healthcare, housing, and labor market. As Canada continues to attract immigrants, it is expected that the population will continue to grow steadily in the coming years, potentially leading to further changes in the country's social and economic landscape.

Summary:

Canada's population touched a record high of 40.77 million in 2023, largely driven by temporary immigration. The country added 1.27 million people, up 3.2% from 2022 and the highest growth since 1957.

item.title: PH, US defense chiefs talk on phone after latest China harassment
item.content:encoded:
Philippines, USA, Defense Secretary, China Coast Guard, West Philippine Sea Summary: Defense Secretary Gilberto Teodoro Jr. and US Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin had a phone conversation regarding the recent harassment by the China Coast Guard in the West Philippine Sea. The two officials discussed the situation and reaffirmed their commitment to upholding international law and ensuring the freedom of navigation in the region. The incident highlighted the ongoing tensions in the disputed waters, with China asserting its claims despite opposition from neighboring countries like the Philippines. The conversation between Teodoro and Austin signals a united front against Chinese aggression and a continued partnership between the Philippines and the US in addressing security challenges in the region. The call underscores the importance of international cooperation in maintaining peace and stability in the West Philippine Sea.

Summary:

Defense Secretary Gilberto Teodoro Jr. and US Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin spoke on the phone in the wake of the latest harassment by the China Coast Guard in the West Philippine Sea.

item.title: Roque: Duterte at Xi, may 'gentleman"s agreement' noon tungkol sa BRP Sierra Madre sa Ayungin Shoal
item.content:encoded: Naniniwala si dating presidential spokesperson Harry Roque na may kaugnayan sa "gentleman"s agreement" noon nina dating Pangulong Rodrigo Duterte at Pangulong Xi Jinping ng China, tungkol sa BRP Sierra Madre sa Ayungin Shoal ang ipinakikitang ang aksyon ngayon ng China sa West Philippine Sea.

item.title: Towed cars, vehicles without RFID slow down traffic at NLEX
item.content:encoded: Several cars broke down and had to be towed, while cash lanes on tollways experienced clogs due to the influx of motorists without RFID passing through the North Luzon Expressway (NLEX) during Holy Wednesday.

item.title: Myanmar junta chief calls for unity, says military holding power 'temporarily"
item.content:encoded: Myanmar's ruling general said on Wednesday the junta was holding power only temporarily with the aim of strengthening democracy, and he called for unity among the people and military to fight armed groups seeking to derail plans to hold an election.

item.title: Commuters, employees ride PNR's farewell trips
item.content:encoded: Employees and passengers of the Philippine National Railways bid its trains farewell on Wednesday.

item.title: Ilang simbahan o kapilya sa Intramuros, bukas para sa Visita Iglesia
item.content:encoded: Maraming simbahan at kapilya sa Intramuros, Maynila ang puwedeng puntahan ng mga Katolikong may planong mag-Visita Iglesia ngayong Holy Week.

item.title: No major lotto winners ahead of Holy Week break
item.content:encoded: There were no winners of either of the big lotto draws on Wednesday prior to the Holy Week break.

item.title: 88% of Filipinos against Cha-cha --Pulse Asia survey
item.content:encoded:
Filipinos, Constitution, Amendment, Pulse Asia, Survey
Filipinos are strongly against amending the 1987 Constitution at the current moment, with 88% expressing their opposition, according to the latest Pulse Asia survey. The survey results indicate that there is widespread resistance among Filipinos to changes in the Constitution. The findings highlight the sentiment of the majority of the population, signaling a lack of support for any constitutional amendments. The survey conducted by Pulse Asia provides a clear indication of public opinion on the matter, showing a strong preference for maintaining the current Constitution. The overwhelming response from Filipinos underscores the importance of considering the public's views and concerns when it comes to potential changes in the country's fundamental law.

Summary:

At least 88% of Filipinos are against amending the 1987 Constitution "right now," the latest Pulse Asia survey showed.

item.title: 2 tricycle driver, nagsuntukan at paluan ng tubo sa Ilocos Norte
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: tricycle driver, caught on camera, fistfight, Dingras, Ilocos Norte Summary: Two tricycle drivers were caught on camera engaging in a fistfight and hitting each other with a pipe in Dingras, Ilocos Norte. The altercation between the two drivers escalated quickly, with the footage showing them throwing punches and using a pipe as a weapon. The incident took place in public, causing alarm and concern among onlookers. The aggressive behavior displayed by the tricycle drivers has sparked outrage and calls for authorities to take action against such violent acts. This incident serves as a reminder of the importance of resolving conflicts peacefully and avoiding resorting to physical violence. Both tricycle drivers involved in the brawl have faced consequences for their actions, highlighting the need for individuals to exercise restraint and seek peaceful solutions to disagreements. The incident sheds light on the potential dangers of allowing personal disputes to escalate into physical confrontations. Efforts to promote conflict resolution and peaceful coexistence among individuals are essential to prevent such incidents from occurring in the future.

Summary:

Duguan ang dalawang tricycle driver na nahuli-cam na nagsusuntukan at nagpapaluan ng tubo sa Dingras, Ilocos Norte.

item.title: 7 dead in police ops after Baste Duterte declared drug war in Davao City -- PNP
item.content:encoded:
Suspects, killed, anti-drug operations, Davao City, war

Seven suspects have been killed in anti-drug operations in Davao City following Mayor Sebastian "Baste" Duterte's declaration of a war against illegal drugs. The operations took place four days after the mayor announced the crackdown on drug-related activities in the metropolis. The suspects were targeted in the efforts to curb the illegal drug trade and eliminate drug-related crimes in the city. The killings signal a strong stance against drug offenders and are part of the government's intensified campaign to address the drug problem in the area. Mayor Duterte's initiative reflects a commitment to maintaining law and order and ensuring the safety and well-being of the residents of Davao City. The decisive actions taken by the authorities aim to send a clear message that illegal drug activities will not be tolerated, and those involved will face severe consequences. The operations underscore the city's determination to combat the drug menace and create a drug-free environment for its citizens.

Summary:

Seven suspects have been killed in anti-drug operations in Davao City four days after Mayor Sebastian "Baste" Duterte declared a war against illegal drugs in the metropolis.

item.title: PCG vessel hits China coast guard ship that blocked its path
item.content:encoded: The Philippine Coast Guard vessel BRP Cabra accidentally hit a China Coast Guard ship that blocked its path on Saturday.

item.title: Road widening activities slow traffic on SLEX amid Holy Week rush
item.content:encoded: Apart from travelers headed to the provinces, road widening activities also slowed traffic in some parts of the South Luzon Expressway (SLEX), Mark Salazar reported on ''24 Oras'' on Wednesday.

item.title: Hanunuo-Mangyan people affected by drought in Oriental Mindoro receive help from GMA Kapuso Foundation
item.content:encoded: Hanunuo-Mangyan residents from Barangay Cambunang in Bulalacao, Oriental Mindoro were among those who were greatly affected by the dry season.

item.title: Despite damage to PH ships, AFP says WPS resupply missions to continue
item.content:encoded: Despite increasing acts of aggression by Chinese forces, the Armed Forces of the Philippines (AFP) said its resupply missions in the West Philippine Sea will continue.

item.title: 75-anyos na lola na nagtitinda ng mga itlog, nabiktima ng pekeng pera sa Pangasinan
item.content:encoded: Hindi pinatawad ng manloloko ang isang 75-anyos na lola na nagtitinda ng itlog matapos na bayaran ng pekeng pera na nagkakahalaga ng P2,000 sa Calasiao, Pangasinan. Ang mga paninda niya inutang lang ang puhunan, natangay pa.

item.title: Bato: Chocolate Hills resort for locals, Boholanos want it to stay
item.content:encoded:
Senator Ronald "Bato" dela Rosa, Chocolate Hills resort, controversial, construction, locals Summary: Senator Ronald "Bato" dela Rosa provided a different perspective on the controversial construction of the Chocolate Hills resort, suggesting that the intention behind the project was to assist the local community. According to dela Rosa, the resort was developed with the goal of benefiting the residents of the area. While the construction of the resort sparked debate and attracted attention, dela Rosa emphasized that the primary purpose was to support the locals. This alternative viewpoint sheds light on the motivations behind the project and aims to highlight the potential positive impact it could have on the community. Overall, dela Rosa's stance brings a new dimension to the discussion surrounding the construction of the Chocolate Hills resort, emphasizing the significance of considering the local perspective and potential benefits for the residents.

Summary:

Senator Ronald "Bato" dela Rosa on Wednesday gave a different point of view on the controversial construction of the viral Chocolate Hills resort, saying it was meant to help locals.

item.title: FOCAP, pumalag sa akusasyon ng China na 'manipulated' ang mga video na kuha sa WPS
item.content:encoded:
foreign correspondents, Manila, China, manipulation, West Philippine Sea Summary: The Foreign correspondents in Manila strongly condemned China's allegation that local and international media outlets are manipulating videos showing the harassment and water cannon attacks by the Chinese coast guard on Philippine vessels in the West Philippine Sea. The foreign correspondents' association denounced the claim, emphasizing the importance of accurate and unbiased reporting on such critical issues as tensions in the South China Sea. They reiterated the need for journalists to uphold journalistic integrity and truthfulness in their coverage of events in the region. The manipulation accusation by China was deemed baseless and an attempt to discredit the media's portrayal of aggressive actions in the disputed waters. The association expressed solidarity with journalists who strive to deliver factual and fair accounts of the escalating maritime disputes, reiterating the journalist's responsibility to document and report on these incendiary events professionally.

Mariing kinondena ang samahan ng foreign correspondents sa Manila ang alegasyon ng China na minamanipula ng local at international media outlets ang mga video na nakikita ang ginagawang panggigipit at pambobomba ng tubig ng Chinese coast guard sa mga sasakyang pandagat ng Pilipinas sa West Philippine Sea.

item.title: Several dead in bus crash on eastern German motorway
item.content:encoded:
killed, injured, bus crash, Germany, Leipzig Summary:

Several people were killed and others injured in a bus crash on a motorway near the city of Leipzig in eastern Germany. The crash occurred on Wednesday and resulted in multiple casualties. The exact number of fatalities and injuries was not immediately clear. Police are investigating the cause of the accident, which took place on a busy motorway. The crash has led to traffic disruptions in the area and emergency services are working to assist those involved in the accident. Authorities have not released any further details about the victims or the circumstances surrounding the crash at this time.

Several people were killed and more injured in a bus crash on a motorway near the eastern German city of Leipzig on Wednesday, police said.

item.title: Gov't agencies, stakeholders agree on inclusion of e-motorcycles in EV tax incentives
item.content:encoded: The inclusion of e-motorcycles in the tax incentives has received no objection, according to views and position papers obtained from government agencies and stakeholders in the electric vehicle industry during the review of Executive Order No. 12.

item.title: Pasig bishop washes feet of political detainees, says they are not alone
item.content:encoded: In a Holy Week ritual symbolizing humility, Pasig Bishop Most Reverend Mylo Hubert Vergara washed and dried the feet of a dozen political prisoners, assuring them they are not alone in their hardships.

item.title: Australia airs serious concern over China's latest water cannon attacks vs. PH vessel
item.content:encoded: Australia on Wednesday expressed serious concerns over China's recent water cannon attacks against a Philippine vessel carrying supplies for Filipino troops stationed at the BRP Sierra Madre in Ayungin Shoal, also known as Second Thomas Shoal.

item.title: Babaeng rider, nakaladkad at tumilapon sa ere dahil sa kable na sumabit sa truck
item.content:encoded: Mistulang inihagis sa ere ang isang babaeng rider, pati ang kaniyang motorsiklo matapos na sumabit sa kaniya ang kable na tinamaan at nahatak ng umaarangkadang truck sa Kerala, India.

item.title: Pope Francis appears in better health at his weekly audience
item.content:encoded:
Pope Francis, health, stronger, Easter week, schedule
Summary: Pope Francis, who has been experiencing poor health, displayed increased strength on Wednesday as he prepared for a busy Easter week schedule. His improved condition was a positive sign as he faced a demanding agenda for the upcoming holiday celebrations. Despite recent health concerns, the Pope's resilience was evident as he appeared more energetic and ready to engage in various Easter activities. This shift in his physical well-being was encouraging, providing hope for his ability to fulfill his duties during this significant period in the Catholic calendar. The Pope's presence and vitality were reassuring for his followers, signaling his readiness to lead the Church through the important observances of Holy Week and Easter.

Pope Francis, who has been in poor health recently, appeared stronger on Wednesday ahead of a busy Easter week schedule.

item.title: China claim of manipulated resupply videos 'a barefaced lie' -- FOCAP
item.content:encoded:
Denounce, China, Allegation, Manipulated, Media

Summary: Manila-based foreign correspondents strongly denounced China's allegation that local and international media outlets manipulated videos showing Chinese harassment of Philippine vessels in the South China Sea. The correspondents refuted the claim that the videos were doctored to support Manila's stance in the disputed waters. They emphasized the importance of accurate reporting and condemned any attempts to discredit media reports. The incident highlights the ongoing tensions in the region over territorial disputes and the need for transparent and unbiased journalism. The correspondents reiterated their commitment to upholding journalistic integrity and providing truthful coverage of events in the South China Sea.

Manila-based foreign correspondents on Wednesday strongly denounced China's allegation that local and international media outlets manipulated videos depicting Chinese harassment and assault of Philippine vessels off the South China Sea to support Manila's claim in the disputed waters.

item.title: DMW issues guidelines for Filipino seafarers traversing Red Sea, Gulf of Aden
item.content:encoded:
guidelines, licensed manning agencies, Filipino seafarers, high-risk areas, conflict areas Summary: The Department of Migrant Workers has issued guidelines for licensed manning agencies to ensure the safety and protection of Filipino seafarers assigned to ships in high-risk and conflict areas. These guidelines aim to provide a framework for agencies to assess and address potential risks and threats faced by seafarers while on duty. Agencies are required to implement measures such as security briefings, risk assessments, and emergency response plans to mitigate risks and ensure the well-being of seafarers. Additionally, agencies are urged to establish communication protocols and support mechanisms to quickly respond to emergencies and provide assistance to seafarers in distress. By following these guidelines, agencies can better safeguard the welfare of Filipino seafarers and uphold their duty of care in challenging maritime environments.

The Department of Migrant Workershas  issued guidelines for licensed manning agencies to observe for Filipino seafarers assigned on ships that would ply high-risk and conflict areas.

item.title: DMW issues payout guidelines for relatives of deceased Saudi OFW claimants
item.content:encoded: The Department of Migrant Workers (DMW) on Wednesday released the guidelines for families of deceased overseas Filipino workers (OFWs) claimants of bankrupt companies in Saudi Arabia between 2015 and 2016.

item.title: Passengers in ports breach 100K on Holy Wednesday -- PCG
item.content:encoded: A total of 119,898 passengers were monitored in all ports nationwide from 6 a.m. to 12 p.m. on Holy Wednesday, according to the Philippine Coast Guard (PCG).

item.title: Baltimore rescuers lose hope for more survivors from bridge collapse
item.content:encoded: Rescuers have lost hope of finding more survivors of the Baltimore bridge collapse as efforts switched to looking for bodies and more answers to why a container ship smashed into the span.

item.title: Some roads near Quiapo closed starting Thursday night --Manila LGU
item.content:encoded: Some roads in Manila will be closed on Thursday night in preparation for a procession to be conducted by the Quiapo Church for Good Friday.

item.title: China"s actions in WPS due to PH violation of deal by Duterte admin -- Roque
item.content:encoded: Ex-presidential spokesperson Harry Roque said the Philippines entered into a 'gentleman"s agreement' with China which bars the country from repairing BRP Sierra Madre in Ayungin Shoal.

item.title: Babae, mistulang nabugbog sa training ng taekwondo nang ipa-spar umano ng coach sa black belter
item.content:encoded: Naospital ang isang 17-anyos na babaeng yellow belter sa taekwondo dahil sa tinamong bugbog matapos umano siyang ipa-sparring ng kaniyang coach sa isang lalaking black belt habang nasa pagsasanay.

item.title: NAIA Terminal 2 hit by power fluctuations
item.content:encoded:
Terminal 2, NAIA, power fluctuations, one hour, issues

Summary: Terminal 2 at NAIA has been experiencing power fluctuations for over an hour causing issues.

NAIA Terminal 2 has been experiencing power fluctuations for over an hour.

item.title: India invites Marcos for a state visit
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Indian government, President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr., state visit, invitation, India
Summary: The Indian government has extended an invitation to President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. for a state visit to India. This gesture signifies the strengthening of diplomatic ties between the two nations. President Marcos Jr.'s visit is expected to foster cooperation and collaboration in various areas of mutual interest, such as trade, investment, and cultural exchange. The official state visit is seen as a significant step towards enhancing bilateral relations and promoting goodwill between India and the Philippines. Indian officials are hopeful that this visit will help in building stronger partnerships and deepening the friendship between the two countries. The invitation reflects India's commitment to engaging with key global partners and furthering diplomatic relationships with nations in the Asia-Pacific region.

Summary:

The Indian government has invited President Ferdinand ''Bongbong'' Marcos Jr. for a state visit to India.

item.title: Imahen ng Our Lady of Fatima sa Sagñay, Camarines Sur, lumuha umano ng dugo
item.content:encoded:
Our Lady of Fatima, Sagñay, Camarines Sur, miracle, investigation Summary: Our Lady of Fatima in Sagñay, Camarines Sur is believed to have shed tears of blood, considered a miracle by some believers. The Archdiocese of Caceres stated that a thorough investigation process will be undertaken to verify this phenomenon. The alleged weeping of blood from the image has sparked interest and raised questions among the faithful. The Archdiocese emphasized the need for a detailed examination before confirming the authenticity of the event. Devotees are closely observing the situation and eagerly awaiting the results of the investigation. The occurrence has stirred emotions and ignited discussions within the community about the significance of the purported miracle. It remains to be seen how the investigation will unfold and what conclusions will be drawn regarding this extraordinary event.

Summary:

Itinuturing milagro ng ilang mananampalataya ang pagluha umano ng dugo ng imahen ng Our Lady of Fatima sa Sagñay, Camarines Sur. Ang Archdiocese of Caceres, sinabing mahabang proseso ang gagawin kapag inimbestigahan ito.

item.title: LTFRB: Colorum PUV's passengers not covered by insurance
item.content:encoded: The LTFRB said passengers aboard colorum public utility vehicles are not covered by passenger accident insurance.

item.title: Seniors citizens age 101 or older in Mandaluyong to receive P100K cash
item.content:encoded: Senior citizens in Mandaluyong City who are at least 101 years old will now receive a P100,000 birthday cash gift.

item.title: Thailand moves closer to legalizing same-sex unions as parliament passes landmark bill
item.content:encoded: Thailand's lower house of parliament on Wednesday passed a marriage equality bill at the final reading, in a landmark step that moves the country closer to becoming the third territory in Asia to legalize same-sex unions.

item.title: Sandigan ruling on Enrile plunder, graft cases over PDAF out in May --Cabotaje-Tang
item.content:encoded: The Sandiganbayan Third Division is expected to issue by May its verdict on the P172-million plunder and 15 counts of graft charges against chief presidential legal counsel and former Senate President Juan Ponce Enrile, his former chief-of-staff Jessica "Gigi" Reyes, businesswoman Janet Napoles, among others.

item.title: DOH: Pertussis cases nationwide rise to 568
item.content:encoded: Twenty-eight new pertussis or whooping cough cases were recorded in the country from March 10 to 16, bringing the total number this year to 568, the Department of Health (DOH) said Wednesday.

item.title: CHR calls for search of 2 environment advocates amid reported abduction
item.content:encoded: The Commission on Human Rights (CHR) on Wednesday called on authorities to conduct an "exhaustive search" for environment advocates Francisco "Eco" Dangla III and Axielle "Jak" Tiong, who were reportedly kidnapped in San Carlos City, Pangasinan.

item.title: LTFRB: Families of Cotabato truck-van collision victims to get up to P200K insurance claims
item.content:encoded: The families of the victims of the collision between a dump truck and a public utility van in Antipas, Cotabato will receive insurance indemnification of up to P200,000, the Land Transportation Franchising and Regulatory Board (LTFRB) said Wednesday.

item.title: PH, Thai lawmakers discuss rice trade, tourism at IPU sidelines
item.content:encoded:
Philippines, Thailand, lawmakers, rice trade, tourism strategies Summary: Lawmakers from the Philippines and Thailand have engaged in discussions regarding rice trade and tourism strategies during the 148th Inter-Parliamentary Union (IPU) Assembly in Geneva, Switzerland. The meeting aimed to strengthen bilateral ties and explore opportunities for collaboration in the agricultural and tourism sectors. Issues related to the promotion of sustainable agriculture practices and enhancing tourism infrastructure were also addressed. Both countries expressed their commitment to increasing cooperation and partnership to boost their respective economies and promote cultural exchange. The talks highlighted the importance of fostering strong diplomatic relations and exploring new avenues for mutual growth and development in the region.

Summary:

Lawmakers from the Philippines and Thailand have discussed rice trade and tourism strategies at the sidelines of the 148th Inter-Parliamentary Union (IPU) Assembly in Geneva, Switzerland.

item.title: Iloilo extends suspension of flag raising ceremonies until April amid extreme heat
item.content:encoded:
flag raising ceremonies, suspension, Iloilo City government, extended, April Summary: The suspension of flag raising ceremonies in the Iloilo City government has been extended until April. This decision was made in response to the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic to prevent large gatherings and promote social distancing measures. The extension of the suspension aims to prioritize the safety and well-being of the community. The city government continues to monitor the situation and will reevaluate the suspension as necessary. The decision to extend the suspension underscores the government's commitment to public health and safety during these challenging times.

The suspension on flag raising ceremonies in Iloilo City government has been extended until April.

item.title: BARMM 2025 polls seen as test of decade-old gov't-MILF peace deal
item.content:encoded:
Bangsamoro Autonomous Region, Muslim Mindanao, BARMM, elections, peace deal
Summary: The first Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao (BARMM) elections in May 2025 will serve as a crucial test for the progress made since the peace deal between the government and Moro Islamic Liberation Front (MILF) was reached a decade ago. House Deputy Minority Leader and Basilan Representative Mujiv Hataman emphasized the significance of these elections in evaluating the gains of the peace agreement. The outcome of the BARMM elections will reflect the stability and effectiveness of the peace process, as well as the level of trust and cooperation between the government and MILF. It will also demonstrate the extent to which the autonomy and self-governance granted to the Bangsamoro region has been realized and embraced by its residents. The upcoming elections will be a pivotal moment in the ongoing journey towards lasting peace and development in the region.

The first Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao (BARMM) elections in May 2025 will test the gains of the peace deal between the government and Moro Islamic Liberation Front (MILF) 10 years ago, House Deputy Minority Leader and Basilan Representative Mujiv Hataman said Wednesday.

item.title: No suspension of number coding in Baguio City on Holy Week
item.content:encoded: Baguio City will still implement its number coding scheme even during holidays.

item.title: BOC seizes P20M worth of shabu concealed as whey protein in NAIA
item.content:encoded: The Bureau of Customs (BOC) said Wednesday its operatives seized over P20 million worth of shabu concealed as whey protein supplements at the Ninoy Aquino International Airport (NAIA).

item.title: 2 alleged NPA financiers charged by DOJ
item.content:encoded:
individuals, charged, collecting, revolutionary funds, financing terrorism
The Department of Justice (DOJ) has announced that two individuals are facing charges for their alleged involvement in collecting funds for revolutionary causes and financing acts of terrorism. The accused individuals are believed to have been actively raising money to support extremist activities, posing a significant threat to national security. The DOJ has emphasized the importance of cracking down on individuals who engage in illegal financial activities that fund terrorism and destabilize regions. The charges brought against the defendants highlight the government's commitment to combating terrorism financing and disrupting the networks that facilitate such activities. The investigation into the case is ongoing, and law enforcement agencies are working diligently to identify and apprehend all individuals involved in these illicit financial activities. The prosecution of these individuals serves as a deterrent to others who may attempt to fund terrorism and underscores the government's dedication to keeping communities safe from extremist threats.

Summary: The DOJ has charged two individuals for collecting revolutionary funds and financing terrorism, highlighting the government's commitment to combating illegal financial activities that support extremist acts. The case underscores the importance of disrupting terror networks and deterring individuals from engaging in activities that pose a threat to national security. An ongoing investigation aims to identify all parties involved in the illicit financial dealings, showcasing law enforcement's dedication to keeping communities safe from terrorism.

The DOJ said two individuals have been charged for allegedly collecting revolutionary funds and financing terrorism.

item.title: 54 buses deployed on March 27 to offset LRT-1"s Holy Week closure -- DOTr
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: passenger buses, deployment, commuters, temporary closure, Light Rail Transit Line 1 Summary: Passenger buses were deployed on Wednesday, March 27, to assist commuters affected by the temporary closure of the Light Rail Transit Line 1 (LRT-1) during the Holy Week. The Department of Transportation (DOTr) organized the initiative to ensure that people have alternative transportation options while the LRT-1 is not operational. Commuters can rely on the buses to continue their journeys smoothly and without major disruption during this period. The deployment of buses demonstrates the government's commitment to providing efficient and reliable public transportation services, especially during times when regular services are interrupted. This proactive approach aims to minimize inconvenience for passengers and maintain the overall efficiency of the transportation system. The use of passenger buses as a substitute mode of transport highlights the importance of contingency planning to address any disruptions in the public transport network.

Summary:

Passenger buses were deployed on Wednesday, March 27, to serve commuters who will be affected by the temporary closure of Light Rail Transit Line 1 (LRT-1) during the Holy Week, the Department of Transportation (DOTr) said.

item.title: AFP to implement changes in WPS resupply missions -- Brawner
item.content:encoded:
Philippine military, resupply missions, West Philippine Sea, China, water cannon attack Summary: The Filipino military personnel were injured in China's water cannon attack during a resupply mission in the West Philippine Sea. As a result, the Armed Forces of the Philippines (AFP) announced changes to the resupply missions in the area. This incident highlights the tensions between the two countries in the disputed WPS. The new protocols are being implemented to ensure the safety of Filipino military personnel during future missions. The attack in Ayungin Shoal has raised concerns about China's aggressive actions in the region and the need for increased security measures by the Philippines. The AFP's response signifies a shift in strategy to protect its forces and assert its presence in the WPS despite Chinese interference.

Summary:

Changes will be applied to the resupply missions in the West Philippine Sea (WPS) after Filipino military personnel were injured in China's water cannon attack during the latest operation in Ayungin Shoal, the Armed Forces of the Philippines (AFP) said Wednesday.

item.title: Manila North and South Cemetery closed from March 27 to 31
item.content:encoded: The North Cemetery in Sta, Cruz, Manila and South Cemetery in Makati will be closed to public starting from March 27, Holy Wednesday, to March 31, Easter Sunday, the Manila City government said.

item.title: LTO to release plastic driver"s license cards starting April 15
item.content:encoded: The LTO said it will release plastic driver"s license cards starting April 15.

item.title: PCG: Over 34K passengers monitored in ports on Holy Wednesday morning
item.content:encoded:
outbound, inbound, passengers, monitored, ports
Summary: Early morning on Holy Wednesday, the Philippine Coast Guard reported monitoring over 19,000 outbound and 14,000 inbound passengers in ports nationwide. This large-scale monitoring effort was implemented to ensure the safety and security of passengers during the busy holiday season. The PCG's vigilance and presence in ports across the country helped to facilitate the smooth and orderly flow of travelers during this peak travel period. By monitoring passenger movements and activities, the PCG was able to uphold maritime security standards and respond promptly to any potential incidents or emergencies. This coordinated effort underlines the importance of proactive measures in safeguarding the welfare of individuals utilizing maritime transportation services. Overall, the PCG's monitoring operations played a crucial role in maintaining the efficiency and security of port operations during the holiday rush.


More than 19,000 outbound and 14,000 inbound passengers were monitored in ports across the country early morning of Holy Wednesday, the Philippine Coast Guard (PCG) said.

item.title: Six workers presumed dead after cargo ship knocks down Baltimore bridge
item.content:encoded:
workers, bridge collapse, Baltimore Harbor, cargo ship, port closure Summary: Six workers are missing and presumed dead after a cargo ship collided with a bridge in Baltimore Harbor, leading to its collapse. The incident occurred as the ship experienced a power loss, causing significant damage and the closure of one of the busiest ports on the US Eastern Seaboard. The missing workers are feared to have been on the bridge at the time of the collision and are now presumed to have lost their lives. The impact of the collapse has disrupted port operations, posing challenges for shipping and logistics in the region. Investigations are underway to determine the cause of the accident and to assess the extent of the damage caused by the collision. The incident highlights the risks associated with maritime transportation and underscores the importance of safety measures in such operations.

BALTIMORE -- Six workers were missing and presumed dead from a bridge that collapsed in Baltimore Harbor early on Tuesday after a massive cargo ship crippled by a power loss rammed into the structure, forcing the closure of one of the busiest ports on the US Eastern Seaboard.

item.title: Estudyante sa Ilocos Norte, patay matapos madaganan ng soccer goal post
item.content:encoded:
student, athlete, accident, goal post, Laoag
Summary: A student athlete from a university in Laoag, Ilocos Norte tragically lost his life after being hit by a soccer goal post. The incident occurred during a soccer game, where the goal post accidentally fell on him. The victim was rushed to the hospital but was pronounced dead on arrival. The university community is mourning the loss of the young athlete, who was a promising player in the sports scene. The accident serves as a reminder of the importance of ensuring safety measures are in place during sports activities to prevent such tragic incidents from happening again. The university and local authorities are conducting investigations to determine the cause of the accident and to take necessary steps to prevent similar accidents in the future.

Binawian ng buhay ang isang estudyanteng atleta sa isang unibersidad sa Laoag, Ilocos Norte matapos madaganan ng soccer goal post, ayon sa ulat ng Unang Balita nitong Miyerkoles.

item.title: Student athlete in Ilocos Norte dies in training accident
item.content:encoded:
athlete, Laoag, Ilocos Norte, killed, soccer goal post

Summary: A student athlete in Laoag, Ilocos Norte tragically lost his life during a soccer training session when a steel goal post collapsed on him. The incident took place while he was undergoing practice, resulting in fatal injuries. This unfortunate event has highlighted the potential dangers associated with sports equipment and the critical need for regular safety assessments to prevent such accidents. The student's untimely death has undoubtedly left a deep impact on the local community, particularly his teammates, coaches, and school staff. It serves as a stark reminder of the importance of ensuring proper maintenance and supervision during athletic activities to safeguard the well-being of all participants. The authorities are likely to conduct investigations to determine the circumstances that led to this tragic accident, emphasizing the significance of adhering to safety protocols in sports facilities to prevent similar incidents from occurring in the future.

A student athlete in Laoag, Ilocos Norte was killed after a steel soccer goal post fell on him during training, Unang Balita reported on Wednesday.

item.title: Religious image in Camarines Sur reportedly shed tears of blood
item.content:encoded:
Our Lady of Fatima, Sagñay, Camarines Sur, Catholic Church, tears of blood

The Catholic Church is investigating reports of an image of Our Lady of Fatima in Sagñay, Camarines Sur, reportedly shedding tears of blood. This phenomenon has garnered attention and concern among the faithful. The image of Our Lady of Fatima is considered a significant representation of the Virgin Mary in Catholicism. The Church, known for its careful examination of reported miracles and supernatural occurrences, is taking these reports seriously. The shedding of tears of blood is often seen as a powerful and emotional sign in religious contexts, believed by some to be a message or warning from the divine. The investigation into this alleged occurrence will likely involve a thorough examination of the image and gathering of testimonies from witnesses to determine the authenticity and significance of the reported tears of blood.

Summary: The Catholic Church is investigating reports of an image of Our Lady of Fatima in Sagñay, Camarines Sur, reportedly shedding tears of blood. This phenomenon has garnered attention and concern among the faithful. The Church, known for its careful examination of reported miracles and supernatural occurrences, is taking these reports seriously. The shedding of tears of blood is often seen as a powerful and emotional sign in religious contexts, believed by some to be a message or warning from the divine. The investigation into this alleged occurrence will likely involve a thorough examination of the image and gathering of testimonies from witnesses to determine the authenticity and significance of the reported tears of blood.

The Catholic Church is looking into reports that an image of Our Lady of Fatima in Sagñay, Camarines Sur has shed tears of blood.

item.title: No Filipino casualty reported in Baltimore Bridge collapse --PH Embassy
item.content:encoded:
Francis Scott Key Bridge, Baltimore, collapse, Filipino citizens, Philippine Embassy Summary: No Filipino citizens were injured in the collapse of the Francis Scott Key Bridge in Baltimore, as confirmed by the Philippine Embassy in Washington DC. The embassy provided assurance that no Filipinos were harmed in the incident. The collapse of the bridge did not result in any injuries to the Filipino community residing in the area. The Philippine Embassy in Washington DC stated that they were in touch with local authorities to monitor the situation and ensure the safety of all Filipino citizens in the vicinity. The embassy urged Filipinos in the area to remain vigilant and follow any safety advisories provided by local authorities. They also offered assistance to any Filipino nationals who may require support or information related to the incident.

Summary:

No Filipino citizens were hurt in the collapse of the Francis Scott Key Bridge in Baltimore, according to the Philippine Embassy in Washington DC.

item.title: North Korean delegation visits Vietnam, KCNA says
item.content:encoded: A senior North Korean official leading a delegation met with his Vietnamese counterpart on Monday and discussed ways to elevate bilateral relations, North Korean state media KCNA said on Wednesday.

item.title: Liquor ban imposed within 500-meter radius of Catholic churches in Manila
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Manila City, Mayor Honey Lacuna, order, ban, alcoholic beverages Summary: - Manila City Mayor Honey Lacuna has issued an order banning the sale and consumption of alcoholic beverages within a 500-meter radius of all Catholic Churches in the city. The ban will be in effect for two days. This decision aims to promote a respectful and solemn environment around the churches, especially during religious events and services. The prohibition is part of efforts to maintain peace and order in the vicinity of the churches and ensure the safety and security of worshipers. Violators of the ban will face penalties as prescribed by the city's regulations. The order underscores the importance of showing reverence and sensitivity to the religious sites and the activities taking place within them. Mayor Lacuna's initiative highlights the city's commitment to upholding the sanctity of church premises and fostering an atmosphere conducive to spiritual contemplation and worship.

Summary:

Manila City Mayor Honey Lacuna has signed an order imposing a two-day ban on the sale and consumption of intoxicating and alcoholic beverages within the 500-meter radius of all Catholic Churches in the city.

item.title: Ship that hit Baltimore bridge also involved in 2016 Antwerp accident
item.content:encoded:
Ship, collapse, Francis Scott Key Bridge, Baltimore, accident Summary: The ship that caused the collapse of the Francis Scott Key Bridge in Baltimore was involved in an accident in the port of Antwerp, Belgium, in 2016. This incident raises concerns about the safety record of the ship and its operators. The ship's involvement in a previous accident suggests a pattern of issues or errors that may have contributed to the bridge collapse. The connection between the two incidents highlights the importance of thorough investigations into maritime accidents and the need for transparency in the shipping industry. As authorities continue to investigate the cause of the bridge collapse, the history of the ship's past incidents will likely play a crucial role in determining accountability and preventing similar accidents in the future.

Summary:

The ship that caused the collapse of the Francis Scott Key Bridge in Baltimore on Tuesday was also involved in an accident in the port of Antwerp, Belgium, in 2016.

item.title: Cebu Doc graduate tops March 2024 Medical Technologists licensure exams
item.content:encoded:
Cebu Doctors University, graduate, topnotcher, March 2024, Medical Technology Licensure Examination Summary: A graduate from Cebu Doctors University emerged as the topnotcher in the March 2024 Medical Technology Licensure Examination conducted by the Professional Regulatory Commission (PRC). The exceptional performance of the graduate reflects the high-quality education provided by the university. Securing the top spot in the licensure examination signifies the graduate's mastery of the necessary knowledge and skills in the field of medical technology. The achievement not only highlights the individual's capabilities but also brings pride and recognition to the alma mater. The rigorous preparation and dedication put forth by the graduate have undoubtedly paid off, paving the way for a successful career in the medical technology profession. This success story serves as a testament to the excellent training and guidance provided by Cebu Doctors University, establishing its reputation as a premier institution for medical education.

Summary:

A graduate from Cebu Doctors University is the topnotcher in the March 2024 Medical Technology Licensure Examination, according to the Professional Regulatory Commission (PRC).

item.title: Provinces offer Holy Week attractions for devotees
item.content:encoded:
attractions, Philippines, Holy Week, creative, devotees Summary: During Holy Week in the Philippines, creative attractions are drawing in devotees from all over the country. These unique attractions offer a different way for people to commemorate the religious holiday. From traditional processions to interactive exhibits, there is something for everyone to enjoy and reflect upon during this special time of year. The diversity of offerings across the Philippines ensures that visitors can experience a wide range of cultural and religious traditions. With stunning displays and immersive experiences, these attractions provide a memorable way for devotees to observe Holy Week. Over the years, these events have become increasingly popular and continue to attract tourists and locals alike. Whether it's through art installations, theatrical performances, or outdoor exhibits, these creative attractions offer a fresh perspective on the meaning of the holiday for all who attend.

Creative attractions across the Philippines are a draw for devotees this Holy Week.

item.title: Barbecue style slow-smoked meat na natikman sa US at ginawang negosyo sa Pilipinas, pumatok
item.content:encoded:
Texas barbecue, slow-smoked meat, business, Philippines, profit
Summary: A Filipino entrepreneur discovered Texas barbecue style slow-smoked meat while on vacation in the US. He decided to bring this concept back to the Philippines and it is now earning up to P40,000 a day. By offering authentic Texas barbecue, he has created a successful business that caters to customers who enjoy this distinct flavor. His unique selling point has allowed him to stand out in the local market and attract a loyal following. The entrepreneur's dedication to replicating the traditional slow-smoking method has paid off, as customers appreciate the authenticity of the flavors. Through his business, he has not only brought a taste of Texas to the Philippines but also created a profitable venture that continues to grow in popularity.

Ang negosyong Texas barbecue style slow-smoked meat na una niyang natikman nang magbakasyon sa Amerika, kumikita na ngayon ng hanggang P40,000 kada araw nang gawin niya sa Pilipinas.

item.title: More than 63,000 people dead or missing while migrating over last decade, IOM says
item.content:encoded: At least 63,285 people have perished or disappeared on migration routes around the world between 2014 and 2023, with most deaths caused by drowning, the UN migration agency said on Tuesday.

item.title: Protecting Palestinians a moral imperative, Pentagon chief tells Israeli counterpart
item.content:encoded: US Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin on Tuesday said it was a moral and strategic imperative to protect Palestinian civilians, calling the situation in Gaza a "humanitarian catastrophe," as relations between President Joe Biden and Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu sank to a wartime low.

item.title: DOJ holds case conference for missing sabungeros as kin lament lack of progress
item.content:encoded:
families, missing sabungeros, case conference, Department of Justice, lack of progress Summary: Fewer families of the missing sabungeros attended a case conference at the Department of Justice, citing a lack of progress. The low attendance at the meeting compared to previous ones was noticeable. The families expressed their frustration over the slow pace of the investigation into the disappearances of their loved ones. The lack of updates and new leads on the cases was a major concern for the families. Despite their hopes for answers and closure, they felt disillusioned by the apparent lack of advancement in the search for the missing sabungeros. The families called for more decisive action from authorities to bring about tangible results in the cases.


Compared to previous meetings, fewer families of the missing sabungeros attended a case conference of their kin at the Department of Justice (DOJ), as they pointed to a lack of progress.

item.title: Anak, binaril at napatay ng kaniyang ama sa Cebu City
item.content:encoded:
sakit, ina, Cebu City, anak, makulong Summary: A mother in Cebu City is experiencing intense pain after her child's death, compounded by her husband's imprisonment. The double whammy of losing a child and having a spouse incarcerated has left her grappling with overwhelming grief and distress. The woman's anguish is heightened by the stressful situation she finds herself in, dealing with both personal loss and the legal troubles faced by her husband. The emotional toll of these combined events is likely taking a significant toll on her mental well-being and overall state of mind. The heartbreaking circumstances highlight the profound challenges and hardships that individuals can face in times of tragedy and crisis. The family's ordeal serves as a poignant reminder of the complex and interconnected nature of personal struggles, illustrating the profound impact that such adversities can have on a person's life. The community's support and empathy are crucial in helping the grieving mother navigate this difficult and trying period.

Dobleng sakit ang nararamdaman ng isang ina sa Cebu City matapos na mamatay ang kaniyang anak, at makulong pa ang kaniyang asawa.

item.title: Taekwondo newbie injured after coach sets up sparring with blackbelt
item.content:encoded:
taekwondo, injuries, coach, sparring, black belt Summary: A 17-year-old yellow belt taekwondo student sustained injuries during a sparring session set up by her coach, who paired her with a taller and heavier male black belt. The incident occurred when the coach allegedly arranged the mismatched sparring session without considering the significant physical differences between the two individuals. As a result, the yellow belter faced a disadvantage due to the black belt's size and strength, leading to injuries. The student's well-being was compromised as a result of the coach's decision, highlighting the importance of ensuring fair and safe sparring practices in martial arts training. The incident serves as a reminder of the responsibility coaches have in protecting their students and promoting a positive learning environment in taekwondo and other martial arts disciplines.

Summary:

A 17-year-old yellow belter in taekwondo suffered injuries after her coach allegedly set her up to spar with a taller and heavier male black belt.

item.title: Binatang natuhog ng mga bakal malapit sa bahay ng kaniyang nobya sa CDO, nakaligtas kaya?
item.content:encoded: Kalunos-lunos ang sinapit ng isang 19-anyos na binata na natuhog sa mga steel rebar matapos mabundol ng isang pick-up truck sa Cagayan de Oro noong nakaraang linggo. Nakaligtas kaya ang biktima na natusok ng mga bakal sa balikat, tagiliran at hita?

item.title: Vietnam says Putin accepted invitation to visit

item.title: No winners of big lotto draws held on Tuesday, March 26, 2024
item.content:encoded:
PCSO, Lotto 6/42, Super Lotto 6/49, Ultra Lotto 6/58, March 26, 2024 Summary: The Philippine Charity Sweepstakes Office (PCSO) drawing on March 26, 2024, revealed that no correct combinations were guessed for the Lotto 6/42, Super Lotto 6/49, and Ultra Lotto 6/58. This outcome signifies that no lucky winners were able to match the drawn numbers for the respective lotteries, signaling a rollover for the jackpot prizes. Despite the anticipation and hopeful participation from players, the lack of winning tickets resulted in the accumulation of the prize pools for these popular lottery games. The unsuccessful drawings highlight the unpredictable nature of lottery outcomes and the challenging odds of guessing the correct number combinations. As a result, the jackpot amounts for the Lotto 6/42, Super Lotto 6/49, and Ultra Lotto 6/58 are expected to increase for the next draws, enticing more individuals to try their luck in winning the substantial prizes offered by the PCSO.

No one guessed the right combinations for the Lotto 6/42, Super Lotto 6/49 and the Ultra Lotto 6/58, drawn by the Philippine Charity Sweepstakes Office (PCSO) on March 26, 2024.

item.title: NBI nabs senior citizen for allegedly posing as a lawyer
item.content:encoded:
senior citizen, arrested, Naic Cavite, posing as a lawyer, notary services Summary: A senior citizen in Naic, Cavite was arrested for allegedly posing as a lawyer and offering notary services. The individual was found to be falsely representing themselves as a legal professional and providing unauthorized notary services. Authorities in Cavite took action against the senior citizen after receiving reports of the illegal activities. It is crucial to verify the credentials of individuals claiming to offer legal services to prevent such fraudulent practices. The arrest serves as a reminder of the importance of verifying the legitimacy of professionals before engaging their services to protect oneself from potential legal issues.

A senior citizen was arrested in Naic, Cavite for allegedly posing as a lawyer and offering notary services.

item.title: Troops hurt by China Coast Guard water cannon require stitches
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: resupply vessel, China Coast Guard, Ayungin Shoal, water cannoned, injuries Summary: Three troops on a resupply vessel were injured by the China Coast Guard's water cannon during a mission to Ayungin Shoal. The vessel was targeted while attempting to deliver supplies to the troops stationed at the disputed shoal. As a result of the attack, the injured troops required several stitches to treat their wounds. The incident highlights the ongoing tensions in the South China Sea, where territorial disputes between China and neighboring countries have led to confrontations at sea. The resupply mission was a crucial operation to ensure that the troops stationed at Ayungin Shoal have the necessary provisions to carry out their duties. The use of force by the China Coast Guard raises concerns about the safety and security of military personnel conducting operations in the region. The injured troops are expected to make a full recovery, but the incident underscores the risks faced by personnel operating in contested waters.

Summary:

Three troops on a resupply vessel that was water cannoned by the China Coast Guard during a recent resupply mission to Ayungin Shoal required several stitches for their injuries.

item.title: Pinay, nagtatrabaho bilang driver ng mga dambuhalang 18-wheeler truck sa Amerika
item.content:encoded: Maliit man sa paningin, dambuhalang mga truck naman ang kaniyang paandarin ng isang Pinay truck driver sa Amerika.

item.title: 81-year-old beaten to death by grandson in Manila
item.content:encoded: An 81-year-old man in Sta. Ana, Manila City was beaten to death by his own grandson, according to a 24 Oras report by Jun Veneracion on Tuesday.

item.title: PH researchers hurt after China chopper hovers low over Sandy Cay
item.content:encoded: Several Filipino marine scientists were injured after they were reportedly harassed by a Chinese Navy (CN) helicopter at Sandy Cay in the West Philippine Sea (WPS).

item.title: 2 environmental activists, nawawala matapos umanong dukutin sa Pangasinan
item.content:encoded:
Environmental activists, missing, abduction, San Carlos City, Pangasinan Summary: Two male environmental activists are missing after being abducted and forcibly taken by unidentified individuals in San Carlos City, Pangasinan. The disappearance of the activists has raised concerns about their safety and well-being within the community. Authorities are currently conducting investigations to locate the whereabouts of the missing individuals and identify those responsible for their abduction. The incident highlights the risks faced by activists advocating for environmental issues in the region and the need for greater protection of their rights and safety. The local community and environmental organizations are calling for swift action to ensure the safe return of the missing activists and to hold the perpetrators accountable for their actions.

Dalawang lalaking environmental activists ang nawawala makaraang dukutin at sapilitan umanong isama ng mga salarin sa San Carlos City, Pangasinan.

item.title: Babae na 3 beses nakunan, napalitan ng 3 supling sa 2 pagbubuntis sa loob lang ng 1 taon
item.content:encoded:
miscarriage, Australia, three, children, pregnant Summary: A woman in Australia experienced three miscarriages but went on to have three children after getting pregnant twice within almost a year. Despite the heartbreaking losses she faced, the woman persevered and eventually became a mother to three beautiful children. Her journey of loss and grief was transformed into one of hope and joy as she welcomed her children into the world. This story highlights the resilience and strength of a mother who refused to give up on her dream of having a family, even in the face of adversity. Through perseverance and determination, she overcame the challenges and embraced the blessings of motherhood, cherishing each child as a precious gift and a symbol of love and resilience.

Isang ginang sa Australia ang tatlong beses nakaranas ng miscarriage, pero nagkaroon pa rin ng tatlong anak makaraang mabuntis siya ng dalawang beses na nangyari sa loob lang ng halos isang taon.

item.title: PCSO's Robles: I'll resign if lotto draws can be rigged
item.content:encoded:
resign, Philippine Charity Sweepstakes Office, Melquiades Robles, lotto games, allegations Summary: The General Manager of the Philippine Charity Sweepstakes Office (PCSO), Melquiades "Mel" Robles, has offered to resign if allegations of rigging in the lotto games are proven true. Robles announced his willingness to step down in response to concerns about the integrity of the lotto draws. The PCSO has faced scrutiny over allegations of manipulation and fraud in their lottery operations. Robles emphasized his commitment to transparency and accountability, pledging to uphold the values of fairness and honesty in the organization. The offer to resign demonstrates Robles' dedication to maintaining the trust of the public and ensuring the credibility of the PCSO's lottery games.

Philippine Charity Sweepstakes Office (PCSO) General Manager Melquiades "Mel" Robles is offering to resign from his post if the allegations that the lotto games can be rigged are proven true.

item.title: Philippines, Japan sign ¥150-B third tranche loan for Metro Manila subway
item.content:encoded: The governments of the Philippines and Japan on Tuesday signed the loan agreement for the third tranche of official development assistance (ODA) financing the country's first underground railway system, the Metro Manila Subway project.

item.title: US lawmakers tell Marcos of support for PH amid latest China harassment
item.content:encoded: Members of a US congressional delegation have expressed support for the Philippines amid the latest act of harassment by China in the West Philippine Sea.

item.title: Zubiri to IPU: Stand with PH for rules-based order in WPS
item.content:encoded: Senate President Juan Miguel Zubiri has appealed to the members of the Inter-Parliamentary Union to stand with the Philippines in promoting international rules-based order in the West Philippine Sea (WPS).

item.title: BFAR issues red tide alert in 7 coastal areas
item.content:encoded: The Department of Agriculture"s Bureau of Fisheries and Aquatic Resources (DA-BFAR) on Tuesday issued a red tide alert on seven coastal areas in six provinces.

item.title: Phivolcs to launch book on disaster survival stories
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Phivolcs, project DANAS, disaster narratives, Filipinos, science communication Summary: The Philippine Institute of Volcanology and Seismology (Phivolcs) has initiated the second phase of project DANAS, focusing on documenting the local disaster experiences of Filipinos in the country. This project aims to gather firsthand accounts of earthquake, tsunami, and volcano disasters to enhance science communication and experiential knowledge. By collecting these narratives, Phivolcs seeks to create a deeper understanding of the impact of natural disasters on communities and improve disaster preparedness and response strategies. Through the DANAS project, the institute hopes to raise awareness about the importance of disaster risk reduction and promote a culture of resilience among Filipinos. The project will play a significant role in educating the public about the risks associated with geological hazards and empowering communities to be proactive in mitigating these risks.

The Philippine Institute of Volcanology and Seismology (Phivolcs) has entered the second phase of its project DANAS: Earthquake, Tsunami, and Volcano Disaster Narratives for an Experiential Knowledge-based Science Communication, which documents the local disaster experiences of Filipinos in the country.

item.title: Lalaki, patay matapos barilin habang nagpapahinga sa duyan sa CamSur
item.content:encoded:
26-year-old, male, shot, hammock, Pamplona, Camarines Sur Summary: A 26-year-old man was fatally shot while resting in a hammock at his home in Pamplona, Camarines Sur. The victim, a male, was found dead at the scene, and authorities are investigating the incident. The shooting took place in the victim's residence in Camarines Sur, where he was peacefully resting in a hammock when the tragedy occurred. The identity of the perpetrator remains unknown, and the motive behind the attack is yet to be determined. The local police are conducting a thorough investigation into the case to apprehend the suspect responsible for the heinous crime. The brutal killing has shocked the community and raised concerns about the safety and security of residents in the area.

Patay ang isang 26-anyos na lalaki matapos barilin habang nagpapahinga sa duyan sa kaniyang bahay sa Pamplona, Camarines Sur.

item.title: Iloilo City declares state of calamity due to pertussis outbreak
item.content:encoded:
Iloilo City, state of calamity, outbreak, pertussis, whooping cough Summary: - Iloilo City declared a state of calamity on Tuesday following an outbreak of pertussis or whooping cough. - The declaration came just a day after the outbreak was announced in the city. - The state of calamity allows the local government to access emergency funds and resources to address the situation. - Pertussis, also known as whooping cough, is a contagious respiratory disease that can be serious, especially in young children. - The city government is taking measures to contain the outbreak and provide necessary medical assistance to affected individuals.

Summary:

Iloilo City has been placed under a state of calamity on Tuesday only a day after declaring an outbreak of pertussis or whooping cough.

item.title: Baltimore"s Key Bridge collapses after ship crash; search for victims underway
item.content:encoded: The 1.6-mile (2.57 km) long Francis Scott Key Bridge in Baltimore, Maryland, collapsed in the early hours of Tuesday after a container ship hit it, and as many as seven people may be in the water, officials said.

item.title: Marcos hopes meeting with US lawmakers to tackle 'geopolitical complications'
item.content:encoded: President Ferdinand ''Bongbong'' Marcos Jr. said his meeting with the US Congressional Delegation would be an opportunity to discuss the geopolitical complications in the region.

item.title: Tricycle driver, patay nang mabangga ng SUV at pumailalim sa truck sa Ilocos; buntis niyang misis, sugatan
item.content:encoded: Nasawi ang isang tricycle driver matapos siyang mabangga ng isang SUV at pumailalim sa isang truck na nasa kabilang linya ng kalsada sa San Nicolas, Ilocos Norte.
