item.content:encoded: S.Korea has 'grave concerns" over China using water cannons against Philippine ships

item.title: BFP to Holy Week travelers: Unplug appliances before leaving home
item.content:encoded:
appliance, power, unplugged, BFP, Holy Week Summary: The BFP advises people who will be away for an extended period during Holy Week to unplug their appliances and switch off the main power source to prevent any potential hazards. This safety precaution helps reduce the risk of electrical fires and conserves energy. It is essential to take proactive measures to ensure the safety of your home and belongings while you are out. Additionally, unplugging appliances also helps save on energy costs and reduces the carbon footprint. Remember to double-check that all appliances are unplugged before leaving to give you peace of mind during your absence. By following these simple steps, you can enjoy a worry-free Holy Week vacation knowing that you have taken all necessary precautions to protect your home.

The BFP reminded people who will be out for long this Holy Week to unplug their appliances and turn off the main source of power

item.title: Taiwan tests air defenses in early morning missile drills
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Taiwan, air defenses, drills, surface-to-air missiles, China
Summary: Taiwan conducted air defense drills involving surface-to-air missiles and various military forces to demonstrate readiness against China's military activities near its territory. The exercises aimed to sharpen Taiwan's defense capabilities and send a strong message of deterrence. Taiwan emphasized its commitment to enhancing training and preparedness to effectively respond to any potential threats. The drills highlighted Taiwan's proactive approach in safeguarding its airspace and sovereignty amid rising tensions with China. The successful testing of air defenses showcased Taiwan's determination to protect its national security and uphold stability in the region. Overall, the exercises served as a show of strength and readiness to defend against any potential aggression from China. Taiwan's continuous efforts to intensify training indicate its resolve to ensure a strong defense posture against external threats.

Summary:

TAIPEI/SUAO - Taiwan tested its air defenses on Tuesday in early morning drills using surface-to-air missiles and air, land and naval forces, saying it would continue to intensify training in the face of China's frequent military activities nearby.

item.title: India backs PH in upholding sovereignty in South China Sea
item.content:encoded:
Philippines, South China Sea, sovereignty, water cannon attack, support

India's Foreign Minister S. Jaishankar expressed support for the Philippines in upholding its sovereignty in the disputed South China Sea. This came after a dangerous water cannon attack heavily damaged a Philippine vessel and injured at least three Filipino Navy personnel. Jaishankar's statement emphasized the importance of respecting international law and ensuring the safety of all vessels navigating the region. The incident highlighted the ongoing tensions in the South China Sea, where multiple countries, including the Philippines and China, have competing claims over the territory. The attack is seen as a provocative act that could escalate the already complex situation in the region. India's support for the Philippines signifies a commitment to upholding the rule of law and promoting stability in the South China Sea. The international community will be closely watching how the situation unfolds and whether there will be any repercussions for the parties involved.

Summary:

India's Foreign Minister S. Jaishankar on Tuesday expressed support for the Philippines in upholding its sovereignty in areas within its territory in the disputed South China Sea following a dangerous water cannon attack that heavily damaged a Philippine vessel and injured at least three Filipino Navy personnel.

item.title: BOC seizes 3 vehicles declared as spare parts
item.content:encoded: The Bureau of Customs (BOC) said Tuesday it had intercepted an attempt to smuggle three vehicles declared as auto spare parts in Cagayan de Oro City.

item.title: NIA: Marcos wants 4 high dams finished by 2028 to address water shortage
item.content:encoded: To address water shortage, President Ferdinand Marcos, Jr. wants the government to finish construction of several dams by 2028, according to the National Irrigation Authority on Tuesday.

item.title: PH Ports Authority warns Holy Week commuters vs. travel insurance scam
item.content:encoded: As millions of ship passengers are expected to travel this Holy Week, the Philippine Ports Authority (PPA) on Tuesday warned passengers against falling victim to travel insurance scammers.

item.title: Villanueva: Senate on track to amend rules for Cha-cha plenary approval
item.content:encoded:
assurance, Senate Majority Leader, crafting, rules, Constitution Summary: Senate Majority Leader Joel Villanueva assures that the Senate is actively developing new rules to decide on amendments to the 1987 Constitution. The chamber is progressing on schedule with the process, providing a mechanism for the Senate to either approve or reject proposed changes. This initiative indicates a proactive stance towards potential constitutional amendments. Joel Villanueva leads this effort to establish a structured procedure for evaluating and deciding on constitutional modifications. The new rules will enable a systematic approach to addressing changes to the fundamental law. It is a step towards ensuring transparency and accountability in the constitutional amendment process. The Senate's commitment to this undertaking highlights its importance in upholding the democratic principles underlying the Constitution. Senate Majority Leader Villanueva's leadership in this endeavor demonstrates a dedicated effort to implement a clear framework for evaluating proposed constitutional amendments.

Summary:

Senate Majority Leader Joel Villanueva on Tuesday made an assurance that the chamber is on track in crafting new rules that will allow the Senate to either approve or reject measures to amend the 1987 Constitution.

item.title: BI deports two alleged 'Luffy" gang members
item.content:encoded:
Japanese, nationals, deported, Luffy, criminal group
Two Japanese nationals, alleged members of the criminal group "Luffy" and accused of committing various crimes in Japan, have been deported by the Bureau of Immigration. The individuals were part of the notorious group involved in illegal activities in their home country. The BI took action against them for their alleged involvement in a string of criminal acts. They were deported back to Japan to face charges and prosecution for their crimes. Japan's authorities had been pursuing the individuals for their illicit activities and sought their extradition. The deportation of the two individuals is a significant victory for both countries in the fight against transnational criminal organizations. The BI's swift action in deporting the accused members demonstrates strong cooperation between the Philippines and Japan in combating cross-border crimes. This development sends a clear message that criminal activities will not be tolerated, and law enforcement agencies will work together to bring perpetrators to justice.

Summary: Two Japanese nationals, alleged members of the criminal group "Luffy" involved in illegal activities in Japan, have been deported by the Bureau of Immigration. The individuals were accused of committing various crimes and were pursued by Japan's authorities for extradition. The deportation is a joint effort between the Philippines and Japan in fighting transnational criminal organizations, showing strong cooperation in combating cross-border crimes. This action demonstrates that criminal activities will not be tolerated, with law enforcement agencies working together to bring perpetrators to justice.

The BI announced that two Japanese nationals, who are alleged members of the “Luffy” criminal group and who allegedly committed a string of crimes in Japan, had been deported.

item.title: NSA Año urges ex-rebels to apply for gov't amnesty program
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: National Security Adviser, Eduardo Año, former members, rebel groups, amnesty program Summary: National Security Adviser Eduardo Año urged former members of rebel groups to apply for the government's amnesty program. The program has officially started accepting applications. Año emphasized the importance of reintegrating former rebels into mainstream society and helping them start anew. By availing of the amnesty program, ex-rebels can receive legal protection and assistance in transitioning to peaceful civilian life. Año's call comes as part of the government's efforts to promote peace and stability in the country. Former rebels are encouraged to take advantage of this opportunity to leave behind their past affiliations and contribute positively to society. Interested individuals should promptly submit their applications and follow the necessary procedures to benefit from the program.

Summary:

National Security Adviser Eduardo Año on Tuesday called on former members of rebel groups to avail of the government's amnesty program, which has started accepting applications.

item.title: DOST: El Niño effects to be felt until August
item.content:encoded: DOST Secretary Renato Solidum Jr. said that the impacts of the ongoing El Niño would continue until August.

item.title: Gatchalian smells conspiracy between BI officers, foreign fugitives in POGOs
item.content:encoded: Senator Sherwin Gatchalian on Tuesday raised the possibility of conspiracy between Immigration officers and foreign fugitives who were captured during the recent raids of Philippine Offshore Gaming Operators (POGO) hubs.

item.title: Passenger vessel hits fishing boat off Oriental Mindoro; 1 missing, 27 rescued
item.content:encoded:
Philippine Coast Guard, fishing boat, missing fisherman, rescued, passenger vessel
Summary:
A fishing boat from Mansalay, Oriental Mindoro, was hit by an unidentified passenger vessel, resulting in one fisherman missing and 27 others rescued by the Philippine Coast Guard. The incident occurred, leading to a search operation for the missing fisherman. The PCG successfully rescued the remaining 27 individuals from the fishing boat collision. The missing fisherman's fate remains uncertain as the search continues. The collision between the fishing boat and the passenger vessel highlights the dangers at sea and the importance of maritime safety measures.

At least one fisherman is missing and 27 others were rescued by the Philippine Coast Guard (PCG) after a fishing boat from Mansalay, Oriental Mindoro was hit by an unidentified passenger vessel.

item.title: DBM releases P1.134B to DepEd for heritage school buildings restoration
item.content:encoded:
DBM, Department of Budget and Management, DepEd, Department of Education, heritage school buildings
Summary:
The Department of Budget and Management (DBM) has allocated over one billion pesos to support the Department of Education's (DepEd) conservation and restoration projects for heritage school buildings. This funding will enable DepEd to preserve and enhance these historic structures, ensuring their long-term sustainability and cultural significance. The investment underscores the government's commitment to protecting and promoting our cultural heritage, particularly in the education sector. It also highlights the importance of maintaining these historical buildings as valuable assets for current and future generations. Overall, this financial support will not only benefit the physical condition of heritage school buildings but also contribute to the preservation of our rich cultural heritage.

The Department of Budget and Management (DBM) has released over one billion pesos to bankroll the Department of Education"s (DepEd) conservation and restoration efforts of heritage school buildings.

item.title: Arnie Teves camp adamant on filing case with UNHRC
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Arnolfo Teves Jr., UNHRC, international law, human rights, defense Summary: The camp of former Negros Oriental representative Arnolfo “Arnie” Teves Jr. is considering bringing his case before the United Nations Human Rights Council (UNHRC) and has defended this possible move by noting that they are within their rights under international law. They believe that seeking assistance from the UNHRC is appropriate given the gravity of the human rights violations they allege Teves has faced. By pursuing this course of action, they hope to bring much-needed attention to his case and hold accountable those responsible for any injustices he has experienced. Their decision to potentially involve the UNHRC underscores their commitment to seeking justice through all available legal avenues. The camp's move reflects their determination to not only address Teves' personal situation but also to contribute to the promotion and protection of human rights on a broader scale.

Summary: The camp of former Negros Oriental representative Arnolfo “Arnie” Teves Jr. is considering bringing his case before the UNHRC under international law to address alleged human rights violations he has faced. They aim to seek justice and accountability while also raising awareness about broader human rights issues.

The camp of former Negros Oriental representative Arnolfo “Arnie” Teves Jr. on Tuesday defended its possible move to bring his case before the United Nations Human Rights Council (UNHRC), saying they are allowed to do so under international law.

item.title: OCD eyeing evening quake drills, various scenario activities
item.content:encoded: The Office of Civil Defense (OCD) is exploring the conduct of evening exercises and various scenario training activities for the succeeding Nationwide Simultaneous Earthquake Drill (NSED) to improve the preparedness of the public during seismic disasters.

item.title: DOH warns vs. kissing babies on lips amid rising pertussis cases
item.content:encoded: The Department of Health (DOH) on Tuesday reminded parents and guardians to refrain from kissing their infants on the lips to help avoid transmission of pertussis, which is a highly contagious bacterial respiratory infection.

item.title: House panel seeks moratorium on adding more MC taxi players in Metro Manila
item.content:encoded: Amid the rise in motorcycle road accidents, the House Committee on Metro Manila Development (CMMD) is seeking a moratorium on further increasing players in the Department of Transportation (DOTr)-led pilot study on the two-wheeled vehicle"s viability as a mode of public transportation.

item.title: Florida's DeSantis signs law restricting social media for people under 16
item.content:encoded: Florida Governor Ron DeSantis on Monday signed a bill that bans children aged under 14 from social media platforms and requires 14- and 15-year-olds to get parental consent, a measure supporters say will protect them from online risks to their mental health.

item.title: Pertussis outbreak declared in Iloilo City
item.content:encoded: A pertussis or whooping cough outbreak is declared officially on March 25, 2024 in Iloilo City.

item.title: Number coding lifted on Holy Wednesday, says MMDA
item.content:encoded:
Metropolitan Manila Development Authority, number coding scheme, lifted, Holy Week, earlier Summary: The Metropolitan Manila Development Authority announced that the number coding scheme in Metro Manila will be lifted earlier than scheduled for Holy Week. This decision aims to ease traffic congestion and make it more convenient for commuters during the holiday season. The number coding scheme, which restricts vehicles based on their plate numbers, is typically enforced on weekdays to manage traffic flow in the city. However, the MMDA has decided to suspend the scheme for the Holy Week to accommodate the increased number of travelers and ensure smoother transportation. This proactive measure is expected to benefit the public and facilitate easier movement around the metro during the festive period. By lifting the number coding scheme earlier, the MMDA demonstrates flexibility and responsiveness to the needs of the community during important occasions.

Summary:

The Metropolitan Manila Development Authority on Tuesday said the number coding scheme will be lifted earlier than scheduled this Holy Week.

item.title: PPA expects over 2 million passengers this Holy Week
item.content:encoded:
PPA, passengers, sea, Holy Week, two million
Summary:
More than two million passengers are expected to travel by sea during this year's Holy Week, as reported by the PPA. This significant number reflects a strong demand for sea travel and indicates a busy period for maritime transportation. The surge in passengers underscores the importance of efficient and reliable sea transportation services during peak travel seasons. The PPA's projections suggest that many individuals will opt for sea travel for their Holy Week observances, highlighting the convenience and accessibility of this mode of transportation. As the number of passengers continues to rise, the PPA and other relevant authorities must ensure the safety and comfort of travelers, as well as the smooth operation of maritime activities to accommodate the high volume of travelers.

More than two million passengers are seen to be traveling by sea in this year"s Holy Week, according to the PPA.

item.title: Motorsiklo, tinangay ng nagpakilalang pulis sa Caloocan
item.content:encoded:
motorsiklo, tinangay, isinanla, pulis, Caloocan Summary: A motorcycle was allegedly stolen and pawned by an individual claiming to be a police officer in Caloocan. The incident was reported by Bam Alegre in Unang Balita. The suspect posed as a police officer when he took and pawned the motorcycle. Authorities are now investigating the case to identify the alleged imposter and recover the stolen vehicle. The incident raises concerns about the safety and security of individuals who may fall victim to fraudulent acts by individuals posing as law enforcement officers. It highlights the importance of verifying the identity of individuals claiming to be police officers before engaging with them in any transactions or interactions. Citizens are advised to exercise caution and vigilance when dealing with strangers, especially those who claim to be officials or authorities, to avoid falling prey to scams and criminal activities.

Isang motorsiklo ang tinangay at isinanla ng isa umanong nagpakilalang pulis sa Caloocan, ayon sa ulat ni Bam Alegre sa Unang Balita nitong Martes.

item.title: DILG probes police official's alleged link to land-grabbing at Masungi Georeserve
item.content:encoded: The DILG is looking into the possible involvement of a police official in the alleged land-grabbing incident at the Masungi Georeserve in Rizal.

item.title: Wounded Philippine Eagle found caught in wild boar trap in Apayao
item.content:encoded:
Philippine Eagle, wounded, trap, wild boars, Unang Balita Summary: A wounded Philippine Eagle was discovered caught in a trap intended for wild boars, as reported by Unang Balita. The majestic bird was found injured and in distress, highlighting the dangers that wildlife face due to human activities. The incident serves as a reminder of the need for conservation efforts to protect endangered species like the Philippine Eagle. It is crucial for communities to be aware of the impact of their actions on the environment and take measures to prevent harm to wildlife. The rescue and rehabilitation of the wounded eagle demonstrate the importance of swift intervention in such cases to ensure the well-being of vulnerable animals. This unfortunate event underscores the urgent need for increased awareness and enforcement of laws to safeguard the habitats of endangered species and prevent further harm to these majestic creatures.

Summary:

A Philippine Eagle was found wounded after it was caught in a trap made for wild boars, Unang Balita reported on Tuesday.

item.title: Putin says Islamists carried out concert attack, implies Ukraine had a role
item.content:encoded:
attack, concert, Moscow, Islamic militants, Ukraine Summary:
Russian President Vladimir Putin acknowledged that the deadly attack at a concert outside Moscow was carried out by Islamic militants. He suggested that the attack benefits Ukraine and insinuated that Kyiv may have played a role. Putin's comments highlight growing tensions between Russia and Ukraine, as well as the continued threat of terrorism in the region. The attack underscores the ongoing conflict between Russia and Ukraine, with both countries accusing each other of aggression and interference. Putin's remarks suggest a possible attempt to shift blame and create further discord between the two nations. The incident serves as a stark reminder of the complex political dynamics at play in the region, with accusations and suspicions fueling further unrest. Putin's comments not only address the immediate aftermath of the attack but also raise questions about the broader geopolitical implications and motivations behind the violence. The response to the attack will likely have far-reaching consequences for relations between Russia and Ukraine.

Summary:

Russian President Vladimir Putin acknowledged on Monday that last week's deadly attack at a concert outside Moscow was carried out by Islamic militants, but suggested it was also to the benefit of Ukraine and that Kyiv may have played a role.

item.title: Hamas tells mediators it will stick to original position on ceasefire
item.content:encoded:
Hamas, Islamist group, ceasefire, Israeli troops, Gaza, prisoners
Hamas has informed mediators that it will adhere to its original proposal for a comprehensive ceasefire in Gaza. The proposal includes the withdrawal of Israeli troops from Gaza, the return of displaced Palestinians, and a 'real' exchange of prisoners. Hamas is standing firm on these conditions as part of the negotiations for a ceasefire in the region. The group's position highlights their focus on addressing the key issues that have fueled the conflict in Gaza and emphasizes the need for a lasting and sustainable solution. By prioritizing the interests and rights of Palestinians, Hamas aims to create a more stable and secure environment for the people of Gaza. The group's insistence on a comprehensive ceasefire underscores their commitment to achieving a resolution that addresses the root causes of the conflict and ensures the well-being of the Palestinian population.

Summary: Hamas has informed mediators that they will maintain their original proposal for a comprehensive ceasefire in Gaza, which includes specific conditions such as the withdrawal of Israeli troops, the return of displaced Palestinians, and a 'real' exchange of prisoners. Their stance emphasizes the importance of addressing key issues in order to establish a lasting solution and create a more secure environment for the people of Gaza. Hamas's commitment to prioritizing the interests and rights of Palestinians underscores their dedication to achieving a resolution that tackles the root causes of the conflict and ensures the well-being of the Palestinian population.

Palestinian Islamist group Hamas said on Monday it has informed mediators that it will stick to its original proposal on reaching a comprehensive ceasefire, which includes the withdrawal of Israeli troops from Gaza, a return of displaced Palestinians and a 'real' exchange of prisoners.

item.title: Trump to face jurors in April before facing US voters in November
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: New York, judge, trial date, Donald Trump, hush-money case Summary: A New York judge has set a trial date of April 15 for Donald Trump's criminal hush-money case, increasing the likelihood of a verdict that could impact his White House aspirations on Nov. 5. The decision to schedule the trial has raised the stakes for Trump, who is seeking to reclaim the presidency amidst ongoing legal challenges. The trial is expected to focus on allegations that Trump was involved in illegal payments to silence women who claimed to have had affairs with him. The outcome of the trial could potentially hinder Trump's political prospects and influence his ability to run for office again. Overall, the trial date announcement sets the stage for a pivotal legal battle that could have significant implications for Trump's future in politics.

Summary:

A New York judge's decision on Monday to set an April 15 trial date for Donald Trump's criminal hush-money case ups the odds the former president will face at least one verdict that could complicate his bid to retake the White House on Nov. 5.

item.title: US, UK accuse China of cyberespionage that hit millions of people
item.content:encoded:
officials, charges, sanctions, Beijing, cyberespionage

U.S. and British officials have filed charges and imposed sanctions on Beijing, accusing the Chinese government of engaging in a widespread cyberespionage campaign that targeted millions of individuals and companies. The campaign allegedly affected lawmakers, academics, journalists, and defense contractors. The charges and sanctions are a response to the cyberattacks that were carried out by Beijing, which have had a significant impact on both the U.S. and British governments and businesses. The accusations also highlight the ongoing tensions between China and Western countries over cybersecurity issues. Beijing has denied the allegations and criticized the U.S. and British governments for their actions. The charges and sanctions are part of a larger effort to address the growing threat of cyberattacks and to hold those responsible for such attacks accountable.

Summary:

U.S. and British officials on Monday filed charges, imposed sanctions, and accused Beijing of a sweeping cyberespionage campaign that allegedly hit millions of people including lawmakers, academics and journalists, and companies including defense contractors.

item.title: Gaza's hungry eat wild plant with no aid relief in sight
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: U.N. Security Council, ceasefire, Gaza, famine, Khobiza The U.N. Security Council is calling for an immediate ceasefire in Gaza as concerns grow over the potential for famine. The territory's civilians, struggling to find food, are turning to foraging for a wild green plant called Khobiza as their only source of sustenance. The desperate situation in Gaza highlights the urgent need for humanitarian aid and an end to the violence that has left many hungry and vulnerable. The Security Council's demand for a ceasefire underscores the critical need for a resolution to the conflict in order to prevent further suffering and food insecurity in the region. The use of Khobiza as a primary food source is a stark reminder of the dire conditions facing the people of Gaza and the urgent need for international assistance and support.

Summary: The U.N. Security Council is urging an immediate ceasefire in Gaza due to concerns about potential famine. With civilians in Gaza facing food shortages, they are resorting to foraging for a wild plant called Khobiza. This underscores the need for humanitarian aid and a resolution to the conflict to prevent further suffering and food insecurity. The use of Khobiza as a primary food source highlights the severe conditions in Gaza and the urgent need for international assistance.

As the U.N. Security Council demands an immediate ceasefire in Gaza and concerns grow that famine may take hold, the territory's hungry civilians are foraging for a wild green plant called Khobiza for lack of anything else to eat.

item.title: Measles outbreak declared in Lanao Del Sur, Maguindanao Del Norte, Sulu
item.content:encoded:
Lanao del Sur, Maguindanao del Norte, Sulu, measles outbreak, declared Summary:

A measles outbreak has been declared in Lanao del Sur, Maguindanao del Norte, and Sulu according to a report on "Saksi." The outbreak poses a significant health risk to the residents of these provinces and requires immediate attention from health authorities. Measures such as vaccination campaigns and public awareness campaigns should be implemented swiftly to contain the spread of the disease. The declaration highlights the importance of maintaining high vaccination coverage rates to prevent outbreaks of vaccine-preventable diseases such as measles. Health officials must work together to address the outbreak and ensure the safety and well-being of the affected communities.

A measles outbreak has been declared in Lanao del Sur, Maguindanao del Norte, and Sulu, according to a report on "Saksi."

item.title: 2 Shitzu dogs' lose ears in Legaspi
item.content:encoded:
dogs, Shitzu, ears, cut, Albay
A pet owner in Albay reported to local authorities that the ears of her Shitzu dogs, Bonbon and Luna, were maliciously cut. The mutilation of the dogs' ears has caused distress to the owner and raised alarm in the community. The act of cutting the dogs' ears is an act of cruelty and has prompted investigations by the authorities to identify the perpetrator. The pet owner is seeking justice for Bonbon and Luna and urges anyone with information to come forward. The incident has left the dogs traumatized and in need of medical attention to address the injuries sustained from the unnecessary and harmful act. Such mistreatment of animals is a serious offense and the responsible party must be held accountable for their actions. The community is rallying behind the pet owner in support of Bonbon and Luna, advocating for the protection and welfare of all animals.

Summary: A pet owner in Albay reported that her Shitzu dogs, Bonbon and Luna, had their ears cut, causing distress and prompting investigations. The dogs need medical attention, and the community is urged to provide information to identify the perpetrator. Animal cruelty is condemned, and justice is sought for the traumatized dogs as the community advocates for their protection and welfare.

A pet owner has reported to the local authorities that someone cut the ears of her Shitzu dogs Bonbon and Luna in Albay.

item.title: 2 dogs in Legazpi City, Albay had ears cut off
item.content:encoded:
ears cut off, shih tzu, animal cruelty, Legazpi City, Albay Summary: An animal cruelty case was reported in Legazpi City, Albay, involving two shih tzu dogs who had their ears cut off. The incident was brought to light by GMA Regional TV Balitang Bicolandia on "State of the Nation." The mutilation of the shih tzu's ears is a clear example of inhumane treatment towards animals. Such acts of cruelty are not only illegal but also showcase a lack of empathy and compassion towards innocent creatures. The perpetrators responsible for this heinous act must be brought to justice and held accountable for their actions. Animal welfare laws need to be strictly enforced to ensure the protection and well-being of all animals in the community. A collective effort is essential to raise awareness about animal rights and promote a culture of kindness towards animals. This unfortunate incident serves as a reminder of the importance of standing up against animal abuse and advocating for the rights of our furry companions.


A case of animal cruelty was reported in Legazpi City, Albay involving two shih tzu that had their ears cut off, according to the report of GMA Regional TV Balitang Bicolandia on "State of the Nation."

item.title: Jellyfish sting kills 10-year-old girl in Araceli, Palawan
item.content:encoded: A ten-year-old girl was killed after she was stung by a jellyfish in Araceli, Palawan.

item.title: Macron says Islamists who hit Russia had tried to attack France
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: President Emmanuel Macron, gunmen, killed, Islamic State, France
Summary: President Emmanuel Macron stated that the gunmen who carried out the attack in a concert hall near Moscow, killing 137 people, were affiliated with an Islamic State branch. He revealed that this branch had also been involved in thwarted attempts to attack France in recent months. Macron's remarks underscore the ongoing threat posed by Islamic State affiliates and the group's willingness to target Western countries. The attack serves as a reminder of the need for continued vigilance and cooperation among nations to combat terrorism. Macron's acknowledgment of the connection between the concert hall attack and previous attempts in France highlights the global reach of extremist groups and the importance of addressing root causes of terrorism. The statement also reinforces the commitment of France and other nations to working together to prevent future attacks. Macron's declaration sheds light on the complexities of the modern terrorist threat and the challenges in identifying and thwarting such attacks.

Summary:

President Emmanuel Macron said on Monday that the gunmen who killed 137 people in a concert hall outside Moscow were part of an Islamic State branch that was behind foiled attempts to attack France over the past few months.

item.title: 17, nasawi sa banggaan ng passenger van at dump truck sa Cotabato
item.content:encoded:
van, dump truck, Antipas, Cotabato, casualties Summary: Seventeen people have tragically lost their lives in a collision between a passenger van and a dump truck in Antipas, Cotabato. The victims were caught in a fire following the crash, adding to the devastation. The incident highlights the dangers of road accidents and the importance of road safety measures. The authorities are likely conducting investigations to determine the cause of the collision and prevent similar tragedies in the future. The community is left mourning the loss of these individuals and grappling with the aftermath of the tragic event.

Summary:

Umabot na sa 17 tao ang nasawi sa nangyaring banggaan ng isang pampasaherong van at isang dump truck sa Antipas, Cotabato nitong Lunes. Ang mga biktima, nasunog pa.

item.title: UN Security Council demands immediate ceasefire in Gaza
item.content:encoded:
Security Council, ceasefire, Israel, Hamas, release
Summary: The United Nations Security Council demanded an immediate ceasefire between Israel and Hamas, with the US abstaining from the vote. The council also called for the immediate and unconditional release of all hostages. This statement comes amid escalating violence between Israel and Palestinian militants, leading to numerous casualties and widespread destruction. The international community has expressed concern over the situation and urged both parties to prioritize peace and negotiations to bring an end to the conflict. The US decision to abstain from the vote reflects a stance of neutrality, potentially opening up opportunities for diplomatic efforts to reach a resolution. The call for a ceasefire and hostage release emphasizes the importance of prioritizing the safety and wellbeing of all individuals affected by the ongoing conflict.

The United Nations Security Council on Monday demanded an immediate ceasefire between Israel and Palestinian militants Hamas and the immediate and unconditional release of all hostages after the United States abstained from the vote.

item.title: Nahuli-cam na lalaking tumawid at biglang naglaho, multo nga kaya ng isang dating nagtatrabaho na malapit sa highway?
item.content:encoded: Ayon sa mga residente, marami nang aksidente at may mga namatay na sa highway kung saan nakuhanan ng video ng isang rider ang misteryosong nilalang na biglang tumawid at biglang naglaho sa Cagayan de Oro City. Ang isang nagtatrabaho na malapit sa highway, sinabing namumukhaan niya ang misteryosong nilalang na dati nilang katrabaho pero namatay na ito.

item.title: Senate panel to hear anti-online piracy bills during break
item.content:encoded: The Senate Trade and Industry Committee will tackle two proposed legislations strengthening the powers and functions of the Intellectual Property Office (IPO) to protect the creative industry against online piracy.

item.title: Two winners win nearly P9 million in Mega Lotto 6/45 on Monday, March 25
item.content:encoded:
winners, jackpot prize, Mega Lotto 6/45 draw, nearly P9 million, Monday night

Two lucky winners were able to share the jackpot prize of nearly P9 million in the Mega Lotto 6/45 draw held on Monday night. The two winners will split the prize evenly, bringing them a substantial windfall. The Mega Lotto 6/45 draw has consistently been a popular game among Filipino gamblers, offering substantial cash prizes for lucky winners. The draw, held on Monday nights, attracts a large number of participants hoping to strike it lucky. The prize money of nearly P9 million is a significant amount that can potentially change the lives of the winners. This win highlights the appeal and excitement of playing the lottery and the thrill of potentially winning a life-changing amount of money. The winners will undoubtedly be celebrating their good fortune and planning how to use their winnings.

Summary:

Two winners share the jackpot prize of nearly P9 million in the Mega Lotto 6/45 draw on Monday night.

item.title: NBI says they had hard time meeting Teves in Timor-Leste
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: National Bureau of Investigation, Arnolfo Teves Jr., Timor-Leste, arrest, meeting
Summary: The National Bureau of Investigation (NBI) director, Medardo De Lemos, revealed that they faced difficulties in meeting former Negros Oriental Representative Arnolfo “Arnie” Teves Jr. in Timor-Leste after his arrest. Despite their efforts, they had a hard time reaching out to Teves in the foreign country. The NBI's attempts to make contact with Teves were obstructed, causing delays in their investigation. The circumstances surrounding Teves' arrest in Timor-Leste added complexity to the situation, complicating the NBI's pursuit of the case. De Lemos emphasized the challenges they encountered in accessing Teves during his time in custody in a different jurisdiction. The NBI's struggle to establish communication with Teves underscored the complications of handling cases involving individuals detained in foreign countries. Overall, the NBI faced obstacles in coordinating with Teves and gathering relevant information related to his arrest.

Summary:

National Bureau of Investigation (NBI) director Medardo De Lemos on Monday said that they had a hard time meeting former Negros Oriental Representative Arnolfo “Arnie” Teves Jr. in Timor-Leste following his arrest.

item.title: 'Nanlaban' theft suspect killed in Batangas
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: police, shot, killed, thief, home intruder Summary: Police in Batangas' Lemery town shot and killed an alleged thief and home intruder during an attempt to arrest the individual. The suspect reportedly resisted arrest, leading to the use of lethal force by the authorities. The incident occurred as part of a response to a reported burglary, highlighting the dangers faced by law enforcement officers in such situations. The decision to shoot the suspect was made in the heat of the moment, emphasizing the challenges and split-second judgments officers often face in dangerous encounters. The incident serves as a reminder of the risks associated with criminal activities and the potential consequences individuals may face when engaging in unlawful behavior. Such incidents also raise questions about police procedures and protocols for handling potentially violent suspects, prompting further scrutiny and debate on law enforcement practices. Overall, the tragic event underscores the complexities and dangers involved in maintaining law and order in communities.

Summary:

Police shot and killed an alleged thief and home intruder in Batangas' Lemery town as the latter tried to resist arrest, Jhomer Apresto reported Monday on 24 Oras.

item.title: After a year of worry, Dinalupihan residents get truck on top of their houses removed
item.content:encoded: For more than a year, an overturned truck on top of two houses in Bataan threatened the safety of its occupants. With help from GMA Kapuso Action Man Emil Sumangil, the vehicle was finally removed.

item.title: Tricycle, nasagi ng pick-up truck at bumangga sa kasalubong na van sa Batangas; 1 patay, 3 sugatan
item.content:encoded: Isa ang nasawi, habang tatlo ang sugatan matapos masagi ng isang pick-up truck ang sinasakyan nilang tricycle at bumangga sa nakasalubong na van sa Padre Garcia, Batangas.

item.title: Lanao Sur solon nixes creation of new municipalities
item.content:encoded: House Assistant Majority Leader and Lanao del Sur Representative Zia Alonto Adiong on Monday opposed two bills seeking to create two additional municipalities in Lanao del Sur province, saying such new partitions are not reflective of the people"s will and could undermine the progress in the Bangsamoro region.

item.title: Two bus drivers test positive for drugs at PITX as Holy Week exodus begins
item.content:encoded:
bus drivers, shabu, random drug test, Parañaque Integrated Terminal Exchange, PITX
Summary: During a random drug test at the Parañaque Integrated Terminal Exchange (PITX), two bus drivers tested positive for shabu. The incident highlights the importance of conducting regular drug testing to ensure the safety of passengers and road users. The use of illegal drugs by public transport drivers poses a serious risk to the public and must be addressed promptly. Authorities at PITX must take immediate action to prevent similar incidents in the future and ensure the enforcement of strict anti-drug policies. This serves as a reminder of the dangers of drug use in the transportation sector and the need for vigilance in maintaining a drug-free workplace. The drivers who tested positive for shabu should be subjected to appropriate disciplinary actions, and measures should be put in place to deter others from engaging in similar behavior. Transit safety is paramount, and all efforts must be made to uphold high standards of professionalism among drivers operating in public transport systems.

Two bus drivers tested positive for shabu during a random drug test at the Parañaque Integrated Terminal Exchange (PITX) on Monday.

item.title: Batang babae, nasawi matapos makapitan ng dikya sa Palawan
item.content:encoded:
Araceli, Palawan; 10-taong-gulang; babae; jellyfish; nasawi

A 10-year-old girl tragically lost her life after being stung by a jellyfish while swimming in the waters of Araceli, Palawan. The incident occurred as she was taking a dip in the sea, and she was unable to receive prompt medical attention to counter the venomous effects of the jellyfish sting. The young girl's family, who was with her during the outing, rushed her to the nearest medical facility, but unfortunately, she did not survive the attack. The community of Araceli was left in shock and mourning over the untimely death of the girl, highlighting the dangers of marine creatures and the importance of being cautious when swimming in unfamiliar waters. The local authorities have issued warnings to beachgoers to be vigilant of jellyfish presence and take necessary precautions to prevent similar tragedies from happening in the future. This heartbreaking incident serves as a reminder of the unpredictable and hazardous nature of marine life.

Summary:

Isang babae na 10-taong-gulang ang nasawi matapos na makapitan ng jellyfish habang naliligo sa dagat sa Araceli, Palawan.

item.title: 14 dead in Cotabato dump truck-van collision
item.content:encoded:
collision, dump truck, utility van, Antipas, Cotabato
At least 14 people were killed in a collision between a dump truck and a utility van in Antipas, Cotabato. The accident occurred on Monday, leading to the tragic loss of lives. The cause of the collision is currently under investigation, with authorities working to determine the factors that led to the fatal crash. The victims of the accident have not been identified and their families are left grieving from the sudden and devastating loss. The collision highlights the importance of road safety measures and the need for stricter enforcement of traffic regulations to prevent such tragedies in the future.

Summary: At least 14 people died in a collision involving a dump truck and a utility van in Antipas, Cotabato on Monday. The incident is being investigated to determine the cause as families mourn the loss of their loved ones. This tragic event serves as a reminder of the significance of road safety and the urgency for enhanced enforcement of traffic laws to prevent similar accidents.

At least 14 people died in a collision between a dump truck and a utility van in Antipas, Cotabato on Monday.

item.title: Landlady ng isang boarding house sa CDO, patay sa pamamaril
item.content:encoded: Patay matapos barilin sa ulo ang isang landlady ng boarding house sa Cagayan de Oro. Ang suspek, nagkunwaring uupa at sinamahan pa ng biktima.

item.title: Video shows China water cannon sent PH resupply crew scampering
item.content:encoded: Video of the water cannon attack by the China Coast Guard of the Philippine resupply ship Unaizah May 4 showed the latter's Filipino crew praying for divine intervention while scampering for safety.

item.title: Palace: Half day work on March 27, 2024 in gov't offices
item.content:encoded: Malacañang on Monday said government office work is suspended on March 27, 2024, from 12 noon onwards, which will allow employees to observe the Holy Week.

item.title: PH security sector meets in Palace after latest China harassment
item.content:encoded: The national security sector of the Cabinet met on Monday to discuss the China coast guard's latest act of harassment against a Philippine resupply mission in the West Philippine Sea, Malacañang has said.

item.title: VP Sara prays for peace, unity on Holy Week
item.content:encoded: As Catholics observe this year"s Holy Week, Vice President Sara Duterte on Monday said she was praying for peace and unity in the country.

item.title: #AskAttyGaby: Sino ang may pananagutan sa sinapit ng 2 bata na nakitang patay sa loob ng kotse sa Pampanga?
item.content:encoded: Nakalulungkot ang sinapit ng dalawang bata sa Angeles City, Pampanga na nakitang patay sa loob ng isang nakaparadang kotse. Ano nga ba ang sinasabi sa batas patungkol sa pananagutan sa ganitong insidente? Alamin.

item.title: 47 Metro Manila roads to be closed for Holy Week repairs
item.content:encoded:
roads, Metro Manila, temporarily closed, repairs, Holy Week Summary:
More than 40 roads in Metro Manila will be temporarily closed to traffic for scheduled repairs, in time for the Holy Week, according to the Metropolitan Manila Development Authority. The closures are part of efforts to improve road conditions and ensure safety for travelers during the holiday. The affected roads will undergo maintenance work to address issues such as potholes, cracks, and other damage that can pose a risk to motorists. The closures are scheduled to take place over the Holy Week period, when traffic is expected to be lighter due to the holiday festivities. Motorists are advised to plan their routes accordingly and to expect delays in the affected areas as repair works are carried out. The MMDA aims to complete the repairs as quickly as possible to minimize disruption to traffic flow and ensure that the roads are safe for use after the Holy Week.

More than 40 roads in Metro Manila will be temporarily closed to traffic for the scheduled repairs in time for the Holy Week, the Metropolitan Manila Development Authority said Monday.

item.title: Marcos back to onsite work on Tuesday
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: President Ferdinand Marcos Jr., flu-like symptoms, return, onsite work, Tuesday Summary:

President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. developed flu-like symptoms last week and had been absent from onsite work since then. However, he is set to return to onsite work on Tuesday after his recovery. This development comes after a period of concern for his health due to the flu-like symptoms he experienced. President Marcos Jr.'s return to work signifies his improved health and readiness to resume his official duties. It is expected that he will resume his responsibilities and continue carrying out his duties as the President. The news of his return to work reassures the public and his constituents of his well-being and ability to lead effectively. President Marcos Jr.'s return also demonstrates his dedication to fulfilling his role despite setbacks in health. Overall, his return to onsite work on Tuesday marks a positive development in his recovery process and signals his commitment to fulfilling his responsibilities as the President.

Summary: President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr., who developed flu-like symptoms last week and was absent from onsite work, is set to return on Tuesday after recovering, reassuring the public of his well-being and commitment to fulfilling his duties as the President.

After he developed flu-like symptoms last week, President Ferdinand ''Bongbong'' Marcos Jr. would return to onsite work on Tuesday.

item.title: Chinese ships harass, perform dangerous maneuvers vs PH vessels during WPS resupply mission
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Filipino crewmen, China Coast Guard, water cannoned, resupply ship, Ayungin Shoal
Summary:
Three Filipino crewmen were injured when the China Coast Guard water cannoned a Philippine resupply ship on a RoRo mission to Ayungin Shoal in the WPS. The incident occurred in the contested waters of the WPS, escalating tensions between the Philippines and China. The resupply ship was on a routine mission to deliver supplies to the Filipino troops stationed at Ayungin Shoal when it was targeted by the Chinese Coast Guard vessel. The attack resulted in injuries to three Filipino crew members and raised concerns about the safety of maritime activities in the area. This incident highlights the ongoing territorial disputes in the WPS and the need for peaceful resolutions to maintain stability in the region.

Three Filipino crewmen were injured after the China Coast Guard water cannoned a Philippine resupply ship on a rotation and resupply (RoRe) mission to Ayungin Shoal in the West Philippine Sea (WPS).

item.title: 'Killua,' positibo sa rabies, ayon sa PAWS; kaso vs pumatay sa aso, itutuloy
item.content:encoded: Inihayag ng animal rights group na Philippine Animal Welfare Society (PAWS) na positibo sa virus na rabies ang golden retiever na si "Killua," na pinatay sa palo ng isang tanod sa Bato, Camarines Sur matapos umanong mang-atake at mangagat ng isang matandang babae.

item.title: Ex-spox James Jimenez expressed intention to return to Comelec- Garcia
item.content:encoded: Former spokesperson James Jimenez has expressed his intention to return to the Commission on Elections (Comelec).

item.title: Intramuros announces traffic routes, parking areas for Holy Week
item.content:encoded: The Intramuros Administration released the list of traffic routes and parking areas for motorists who will visit the Walled City during the Holy Week.

item.title: Mga Pinoy sa Kuwait na paso na ang visa, hinikayat na samantalahin ang amnesty program
item.content:encoded:
visa, amnesty program, Kuwait, Filipino, encourage Summary: The article encourages Filipinos in Kuwait whose visas have expired to take advantage of the visa amnesty program being implemented by the government of the country in the Middle East. The program offers an opportunity for individuals with expired visas to regularize their status without facing penalties or fines. It aims to provide a chance for individuals to rectify their legal standing and possibly secure a new visa or re-enter the country legally. Filipinos are urged to make use of this opportunity to avoid any legal complications and to ensure their safety and security in Kuwait. This program serves as a lifeline for those who may be facing difficulties with their visa status and offers a way for them to resolve their situation in a lawful manner. The Filipino community in Kuwait is encouraged to spread awareness about the visa amnesty program and help their fellow compatriots take advantage of this initiative. It is a timely and beneficial opportunity for Filipinos in Kuwait to regularize their stay and avoid any potential legal issues.

Summary:

Hinikayat ang mga Pinoy sa Kuwait na paso na ang visa na samantalahin ang visa amnesty program na ipinatutupad ng pamahalaan ng nasabing bansa sa Gitnang Silangan.

item.title: PCSO: No lotto draws from Maundy Thursday to Easter Sunday
item.content:encoded:
Philippine Charity Sweepstakes Office, PCSO, lotto draws, Maundy Thursday, Easter Sunday

Summary: The Philippine Charity Sweepstakes Office (PCSO) has decided to halt lotto draws during Maundy Thursday and Easter Sunday to honor Holy Week. This decision is part of the observance of the sacred holiday, allowing individuals to focus on spiritual practices. The suspension will involve all lotto games operated by PCSO, encouraging participants to take a break and indulge in the customs of Holy Week.By pausing the lotto draws during this significant period, PCSO aims to show respect to the religious beliefs and traditions upheld during Holy Week. This decision will provide an opportunity for both players and PCSO staff to observe the holiday with reverence and devotion, emphasizing the importance of solemnity and reflection during this time.

The Philippine Charity Sweepstakes Office (PCSO) announced Monday that it will suspend the lotto draws from Maundy Thursday to Easter Sunday in observance of Holy Week.

item.title: DOH: Pertussis cases 'plateauing" in NCR
item.content:encoded:
Number, Pertussis, Whooping cough, Metro Manila, Plateauing Summary: The Department of Health (DOH) reported that the number of pertussis or whooping cough cases in Metro Manila is plateauing, while other regions are experiencing an increase in cases. This indicates a stabilization of cases in the capital city compared to other areas. The DOH's monitoring and response efforts may be effectively controlling the spread of the disease in Metro Manila. The plateauing of cases suggests that preventive measures and vaccinations are helping to contain the outbreak in the region. The DOH's data shows a contrast between Metro Manila and other regions in terms of pertussis cases, emphasizing the need for targeted interventions based on the specific trends observed in different areas.

Summary:

The number of pertussis or whooping cough cases in Metro Manila is plateauing even as other regions reported an increase in cases, the Department of Health (DOH) said Monday.

item.title: Immigration personnel banned from going on leave during Lenten Season
item.content:encoded: The Bureau of Immigration (BI) on Monday announced that its personnel in all international ports have been banned from going on leave to ensure adequate manpower during the Lenten Season.

item.title: Babeng mayor sa Ecuador n 27-anyos lang, nilikida kasama ang kaniyang tagapayo
item.content:encoded: Natagpuang patay sa loob ng sasakyan at may tama ng bala ng baril ang pinakabata at babaeng mayor sa Eduador, kasama ang isa niyang tauhan. Hinanakit ng kaniyang kapartido, "Nobody is safe in Ecuador."

item.title: SC to remove judges" power to conduct preliminary probe -- DOJ official
item.content:encoded: The Supreme Court is set to remove the power of court judges to conduct a preliminary investigation or review the findings of the Department of Justice (DOJ) on whether there is sufficient ground that a crime has been committed, an official said Monday.

item.title: Gatchalian raises mayor's possible link to raided POGO hub in Tarlac
item.content:encoded: Senator Sherwin Gatchalian on Monday urged the Department of the Interior and Local Government (DILG) to investigate a local government official in Tarlac over possible links to a recently raided POGO hub in the province.

item.title: Task Force El Niño orders BFP to ensure fire safety of public health facilities
item.content:encoded: The government's Task Force El Niño ordered the Bureau of Fire Protection to inspect and ensure the fire safety of all public hospitals and public health facilities.

item.title: Marcos offers prayers for healing of UK royal Catherine
item.content:encoded: President Ferdinand ''Bongbong'' Marcos Jr. on Monday offered prayers for Catherine, Britain's Princess of Wales, after she disclosed that her major abdominal surgery in January led to the discovery of her cancer.

item.title: PAWS says Killua tested positive for rabies, to pursue case vs suspected killer
item.content:encoded: The Philippine Animal Welfare Society (PAWS) on Monday said the body of Killua, the three-year-old golden retriever killed in Bato, Camarines Sur, has tested positive for the rabies virus.

item.title: Arnie Teves camp says they are ready for anything
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Arnolfo Teves Jr., Negros Oriental, charges, repatriated, camp Summary: Arnolfo “Arnie” Teves Jr.'s camp in Negros Oriental is prepared for his repatriation to the Philippines to face the charges against him. Teves, a former representative, is currently outside the country and is wanted for various offenses. His supporters are standing by to assist him upon his return. The camp maintains readiness despite the uncertainty surrounding Teves' return. They are committed to cooperating with authorities in addressing the allegations against him. Teves, who has been living abroad, is aware of the legal proceedings awaiting him in the Philippines. The camp is mobilized and prepared to address any challenges that may arise during his repatriation. Despite the circumstances, Teves' supporters remain steadfast in their support for him. The former lawmaker is expected to return to the Philippines to face the legal consequences of his actions.

Summary: Arnolfo “Arnie” Teves Jr.'s camp is ready for his repatriation to the Philippines to address the charges against him, displaying unwavering support and readiness to cooperate with authorities.

The camp of former Negros Oriental representative Arnolfo “Arnie” Teves Jr. on Monday said they are ready should the former lawmaker be repatriated back to the Philippines to face the charges against him.

item.title: MMDA: No number coding on Maundy Thursday, Good Friday
item.content:encoded:
Metropolitan Manila Development Authority, public, number coding, suspended, March 28

Summary: The Metropolitan Manila Development Authority announced that the number coding scheme will be suspended on March 28, Maundy Thursday, and March 29, Good Friday. This suspension aims to accommodate the public who may be traveling during the Lenten season. Motorists are reminded that they will not be restricted by the number coding scheme on these dates. The MMDA encourages everyone to plan their trips accordingly and to follow traffic rules and regulations to ensure a safe and orderly flow of traffic. It is important for drivers to be mindful of their responsibility on the road to promote road safety and prevent accidents. The public is advised to stay updated on any further announcements from the MMDA regarding traffic advisories during the Lenten season.

The Metropolitan Manila Development Authority on Monday reminded the public that number coding is suspended on March 28, Maundy Thursday, and March 29, Good Friday.

item.title: DFA summons Chinese Embassy exec over latest Ayungin incident
item.content:encoded:
Philippines, China, Ayungin Shoal, Chinese Embassy, dangerous maneuver
Summary:
The Philippines summoned the chargé d'affaires of the Chinese Embassy on Monday morning following a dangerous maneuver by the China Coast Guard against a Philippine vessel in Ayungin Shoal. The move was seen as a provocation by China towards the Philippines, escalating tensions between the two countries. The Philippine government expressed its concerns over the incident and demanded an explanation from the Chinese authorities. The Ayungin Shoal is a disputed area in the South China Sea, claimed by both the Philippines and China. The dangerous maneuver by the China Coast Guard further complicates the already tense situation in the region, raising fears of potential conflict between the two countries. The Philippines' decision to summon the Chinese Embassy official signals its strong stance against any aggressive actions in the disputed waters.

The Philippines on Monday morning summoned the chargé d'affaires of the Chinese Embassy following the China Coast Guard"s dangerous maneuver against a Philippine vessel in Ayungin Shoal.

item.title: 3 men seen gathering spiders at night stir residents in Argao, Cebu
item.content:encoded: The presence of three persons who are not reportedly from Barangay Bulasa, Argao town, Cebu Province alerted residents.

item.title: DND chief Teodoro to China: Put maritime claim to arbitration
item.content:encoded: Defense Secretary Gilbert Teodoro Jr. on Monday challenged China to put its sovereignty claim to arbitration after it had warned the Philippines to bear all ''potential consequences'' amid its actions in the South China Sea.

item.title: Philippines holds simultaneous earthquake drills
item.content:encoded: The Philippines conducted simultaneous earthquake drills to raise preparedness during earthquakes.

item.title: Many bus trips already fully booked as Holy Week exodus starts
item.content:encoded: Many passengers seeking to go to the provinces for the Holy Week have started flocking to bus terminals in Metro Manila early, with many bus trips already fully booked.

item.title: King Charles 'frustrated" by pace of cancer recovery, nephew says
item.content:encoded: King Charles is "frustrated" by the pace of his recuperation from cancer, his nephew Peter Phillips said on Sunday, becoming the first member of the royal family to speak in detail about how the monarch was faring.

item.title: US, Japan plan biggest upgrade to security pact in over 60 years, FT reports
item.content:encoded: The US and Japan are planning the biggest upgrade to their security alliance since the two countries signed a mutual defense treaty in 1960, the Financial Times reported on Sunday.

item.title: Rescuers race to find trapped people as Brazil storms kill at least 20
item.content:encoded: Rescuers in boats and aircraft raced against the clock Sunday to help isolated people in Brazil's mountainous southeast after storms and heavy rains killed at least 20 people.

item.title: France charters evacuation flights from Haiti for its nationals
item.content:encoded: France is organizing government-chartered flights from Haiti to help its nationals seeking to leave the Caribbean country, which has been gripped by gang violence, the French foreign ministry said on Sunday.

item.title: Nigerian army rescues abducted Kaduna students
item.content:encoded: The Nigerian army on Sunday rescued students and staff who were abducted by gunmen from a school in the country's north earlier this month, the military said, days before the deadline for a ransom payment.

item.title: Mountain lion kills man, injures brother in rare California fatal attack
item.content:encoded: A mountain lion killed a 21-year-old man and gravely wounded his younger brother in California's El Dorado County, northwest of Sacramento on Saturday, local authorities said.

item.title: Ecuador"s youngest mayor found shot to death alongside advisor
item.content:encoded: Ecuador's youngest mayor, Brigitte Garcia, and an advisor were found shot dead in a car early on Sunday, said police in the South American country, which is in the grips of a wave of violence that authorities blame on drug trafficking

item.title: Ano ang kahalagahan ng Visita Iglesia sa mga mananampalataya?
item.content:encoded: Sa tuwing Huwebes o Biyernes Santo, isa sa mga panatang isinasagawa ng mga Katoliko ang Visita Iglesia, o pagdalaw sa pito o 14 na mga simbahan sa iba"t ibang lugar. Ano nga ba ang kahalagahan nito para sa mga mananampalataya?
